content.text:
Base directory for this skill: /Users/alex/.claude/skills/github-pr-review

# GitHub PR Review

## Overview

Technical mechanics for GitHub PR review workflows via `gh` CLI. Covers fetching review comments, replying to threads, creating/updating PRs.

**Companion skill:** For *how to evaluate* feedback, see `superpowers:receiving-code-review`. This skill covers *how to interact* with GitHub.

**Security:** Use fine-grained PAT with minimal permissions.

## Setup (One-Time)

### Fine-Grained PAT

Create at github.com -> Settings -> Developer settings -> Personal access tokens -> Fine-grained tokens:

| Permission | Level |
|------------|-------|
| Pull requests | Read & Write |
| Contents | Read |

**Can't:** Delete repos, push code, delete branches, manage settings.

### Configure & Allowlist

```bash
export GH_TOKEN="github_pat_xxxx"
```

Add to `.claude/settings.json`:
```json
{
  "permissions": {
    "allow": [
      "Bash(gh repo view:*)",
      "Bash(gh pr view:*)",
      "Bash(gh pr create:*)",
      "Bash(gh pr ready:*)",
      "Bash(gh pr edit:*)",
      "Bash(gh api repos/*/*/pulls/*/comments:*)",
      "Bash(gh api repos/*/*/pulls/*/comments/*/replies:*)"
    ]
  }
}
```

## Quick Reference

| Operation | Command |
|-----------|---------|
| Get owner/repo | `gh repo view --json owner,name -q '"\(.owner.login)/\(.name)"'` |
| Get PR number | `gh pr view --json number -q .number` |
| Get PR author | `gh pr view --json author -q .author.login` |
| Fetch all review comments | `gh api repos/{owner}/{repo}/pulls/{pr}/comments --paginate` |
| Get single comment | `gh api repos/{owner}/{repo}/pulls/comments/{comment_id}` |
| Reply to comment | `gh api repos/{owner}/{repo}/pulls/{pr}/comments/{comment_id}/replies -f body="msg"` |
| Create PR | `gh pr create --title "T" --body "B" [--draft]` |
| Mark ready | `gh pr ready [number]` |
| Convert to draft | `gh pr ready --undo [number]` |
| Edit PR | `gh pr edit [number] --title "T" --body "B"` |

## Workflow: Respond to PR Review

### 1. Get repo info and PR details

```bash
owner_repo=$(gh repo view --json owner,name -q '"\(.owner.login)/\(.name)"')
pr_number=$(gh pr view --json number -q .number)
pr_author=$(gh pr view --json author -q .author.login)
```

### 2. Fetch and analyze threads

```bash
# Fetch all comments and group into threads, showing last author per thread
gh api repos/${owner_repo}/pulls/${pr_number}/comments --paginate | jq 'sort_by([.in_reply_to_id // .id, .created_at]) | group_by(.in_reply_to_id // .id) | map({thread_id: (.[0].in_reply_to_id // .[0].id), path: .[0].path, line: (.[0].line // .[0].original_line), last_author: .[-1].user.login, last_body: .[-1].body[0:100], count: length})'
```

### 3. Filter to threads needing response

```bash
# Filter to threads where last_author != PR author
# Note: Use '| not' instead of '!=' to avoid shell escaping issues with !
... | jq --arg author "$pr_author" '[.[] | select(.last_author == $author | not)]'
```

For each thread needing response:
- Read the comment + file/line context
- Apply `superpowers:receiving-code-review` skill for evaluation
- Fix code and/or reply to thread

### 4. Commit fixes and push
- run the build, tests, linting as required
- commit the changes, noting the commit sha
- push the changes so they're visible
- We need to do this FIRST so we have the commit shas to put into the replies to the pr review

### 5. Re-fetch comment IDs (if rebased)

**Important:** If you rebased or force-pushed, comment IDs may have changed. Re-fetch the comment threads before replying:

```bash
gh api repos/${owner_repo}/pulls/${pr_number}/comments --paginate | jq '...'
```

### 6. Reply to a thread

```bash
gh api repos/${owner_repo}/pulls/${pr_number}/comments/{comment_id}/replies \
  -f body="Fixed in commit abc123. [description of fix]"
```

### 7. Summarize and finish

After all threads addressed, ask if ready to mark PR ready for review.

**Note:** REST API doesn't expose "resolved" status. We infer "done" when PR author made last comment in thread.

## Common Mistakes

| Mistake | Fix |
|---------|-----|
| Broad PAT permissions | Use fine-grained PAT with only Pull requests + Contents |
| Missing pagination | Always use `--paginate` for comment fetching |
| Top-level reply | Use `/comments/{id}/replies` endpoint, not `/comments` |
| Re-responding to threads | Skip threads where PR author made last comment |
| Forgetting to reply after fix | Always reply to confirm the fix was made |
| jq `!=` fails with shell error | Use `select(.x == "y" \| not)` instead of `select(.x != "y")` |
| 404 on reply after rebase | Comment IDs change after force-push/rebase. Re-fetch comments before replying |
I'll start by getting the repo info, PR details, and fetching review comments.

input.command: gh pr view --json number,title,author,state -q '{ number: .number, title: .title, author: .author.login, state: .state }'

[ { "thread_id": 2778466000, "path": "cmd/entire/cli/session/state.go", "line": 57, "last_author": "cursor[bot]", "last_body": "### Missing backward compat migration for LastInteractionTime field **Low Severity** The field `LastInteractionAt` was renamed to `LastInteractionTime` with its JSON tag changed from `last_interaction_at` to `last_interaction_time`. Unlike other renamed fields in this PR (e.g., `StepCount` keeps the old JSON tag, `CondensedTranscriptLines` has a deprecated field with migration), there's no backward compatibility handling. When loading existing session state files, the `LastInteractionTime` field will be `nil`, causing the "active X ago" text in `entire status` output to not display until the next user interaction.
Additional Locations (1) - [`cmd/entire/cli/session/state.go#L138-L158`](https://github.com/entireio/cli/blob/2d5c2cca28de7cfd8e2bb30006b3b342b13aaf2e/cmd/entire/cli/session/state.go#L138-L158)

 

", "count": 1 } ]

content.text: There's one thread needing a response — a cursor[bot] comment about missing backward compatibility for the `LastInteractionTime` field rename. Let me read the relevant code to evaluate this.

content.content:
1→package session
     2→
     3→import (
     4→	"context"
     5→	"encoding/json"
     6→	"fmt"
     7→	"os"
     8→	"os/exec"
     9→	"path/filepath"
    10→	"strings"
    11→	"time"
    12→
    13→	"github.com/entireio/cli/cmd/entire/cli/agent"
    14→	"github.com/entireio/cli/cmd/entire/cli/checkpoint/id"
    15→	"github.com/entireio/cli/cmd/entire/cli/jsonutil"
    16→	"github.com/entireio/cli/cmd/entire/cli/validation"
    17→)
    18→
    19→const (
    20→	// SessionStateDirName is the directory name for session state files within git common dir.
    21→	SessionStateDirName = "entire-sessions"
    22→)
    23→
    24→// State represents the state of an active session.
    25→// This is stored in .git/entire-sessions/<session-id>.json
    26→type State struct {
    27→	// SessionID is the unique session identifier
    28→	SessionID string `json:"session_id"`
    29→
    30→	// BaseCommit is the HEAD commit when the session started
    31→	BaseCommit string `json:"base_commit"`
    32→
    33→	// WorktreePath is the absolute path to the worktree root
    34→	WorktreePath string `json:"worktree_path,omitempty"`
    35→
    36→	// WorktreeID is the internal git worktree identifier (empty for main worktree)
    37→	// Derived from .git/worktrees/<name>/, stable across git worktree move
    38→	WorktreeID string `json:"worktree_id,omitempty"`
    39→
    40→	// StartedAt is when the session was started
    41→	StartedAt time.Time `json:"started_at"`
    42→
    43→	// EndedAt is when the session was explicitly closed by the user.
    44→	// nil means the session is still active or was not cleanly closed.
    45→	EndedAt *time.Time `json:"ended_at,omitempty"`
    46→
    47→	// Phase is the lifecycle stage of this session (see phase.go).
    48→	// Empty means idle (backward compat with pre-state-machine files).
    49→	Phase Phase `json:"phase,omitempty"`
    50→
    51→	// PendingCheckpointID is the checkpoint ID for the current commit cycle.
    52→	// Generated once when first needed, reused across all commits in the session.
    53→	PendingCheckpointID string `json:"pending_checkpoint_id,omitempty"`
    54→
    55→	// LastInteractionTime is updated on every hook invocation.
    56→	// Used for stale session detection in "entire sessions fix".
    57→	LastInteractionTime *time.Time `json:"last_interaction_time,omitempty"`
    58→
    59→	// StepCount is the number of checkpoints/steps created in this session.
    60→	// JSON tag kept as "checkpoint_count" for backward compatibility with existing state files.
    61→	StepCount int `json:"checkpoint_count"`
    62→
    63→	// CheckpointTranscriptStart is the transcript line offset where the current
    64→	// checkpoint cycle began. Set to 0 at session start, updated to current
    65→	// transcript length after each condensation. Used to scope the transcript
    66→	// for checkpoint condensation: "everything since last checkpoint".
    67→	CheckpointTranscriptStart int `json:"checkpoint_transcript_start,omitempty"`
    68→
    69→	// Deprecated: CondensedTranscriptLines is replaced by CheckpointTranscriptStart.
    70→	// Kept for backward compatibility with existing state files.
    71→	// Use NormalizeAfterLoad() to migrate.
    72→	CondensedTranscriptLines int `json:"condensed_transcript_lines,omitempty"`
    73→
    74→	// UntrackedFilesAtStart tracks files that existed at session start (to preserve during rewind)
    75→	UntrackedFilesAtStart []string `json:"untracked_files_at_start,omitempty"`
    76→
    77→	// FilesTouched tracks files modified/created/deleted during this session
    78→	FilesTouched []string `json:"files_touched,omitempty"`
    79→
    80→	// LastCheckpointID is the checkpoint ID from last condensation, reused for subsequent commits without new content
    81→	LastCheckpointID id.CheckpointID `json:"last_checkpoint_id,omitempty"`
    82→
    83→	// AgentType identifies the agent that created this session (e.g., "Claude Code", "Gemini CLI", "Cursor")
    84→	AgentType agent.AgentType `json:"agent_type,omitempty"`
    85→
    86→	// Token usage tracking (accumulated across all checkpoints in this session)
    87→	TokenUsage *agent.TokenUsage `json:"token_usage,omitempty"`
    88→
    89→	// Deprecated: TranscriptLinesAtStart is replaced by CheckpointTranscriptStart.
    90→	// Kept for backward compatibility with existing state files.
    91→	TranscriptLinesAtStart int `json:"transcript_lines_at_start,omitempty"`
    92→
    93→	// TranscriptIdentifierAtStart is the last transcript identifier when the session started.
    94→	// Used for identifier-based transcript scoping (UUID for Claude, message ID for Gemini).
    95→	TranscriptIdentifierAtStart string `json:"transcript_identifier_at_start,omitempty"`
    96→
    97→	// TranscriptPath is the path to the live transcript file (for mid-session commit detection)
    98→	TranscriptPath string `json:"transcript_path,omitempty"`
    99→
   100→	// FirstPrompt is the first user prompt that started this session (truncated for display)
   101→	FirstPrompt string `json:"first_prompt,omitempty"`
   102→
   103→	// PromptAttributions tracks user and agent line changes at each prompt start.
   104→	// This enables accurate attribution by capturing user edits between checkpoints.
   105→	PromptAttributions []PromptAttribution `json:"prompt_attributions,omitempty"`
   106→
   107→	// PendingPromptAttribution holds attribution calculated at prompt start (before agent runs).
   108→	// This is moved to PromptAttributions when SaveChanges is called.
   109→	PendingPromptAttribution *PromptAttribution `json:"pending_prompt_attribution,omitempty"`
   110→}
   111→
   112→// PromptAttribution captures line-level attribution data at the start of each prompt.
   113→// By recording what changed since the last checkpoint BEFORE the agent works,
   114→// we can accurately separate user edits from agent contributions.
   115→type PromptAttribution struct {
   116→	// CheckpointNumber is which checkpoint this was recorded before (1-indexed)
   117→	CheckpointNumber int `json:"checkpoint_number"`
   118→
   119→	// UserLinesAdded is lines added by user since the last checkpoint
   120→	UserLinesAdded int `json:"user_lines_added"`
   121→
   122→	// UserLinesRemoved is lines removed by user since the last checkpoint
   123→	UserLinesRemoved int `json:"user_lines_removed"`
   124→
   125→	// AgentLinesAdded is total agent lines added so far (base → last checkpoint).
   126→	// Always 0 for checkpoint 1 since there's no previous checkpoint to measure against.
   127→	AgentLinesAdded int `json:"agent_lines_added"`
   128→
   129→	// AgentLinesRemoved is total agent lines removed so far (base → last checkpoint).
   130→	// Always 0 for checkpoint 1 since there's no previous checkpoint to measure against.
   131→	AgentLinesRemoved int `json:"agent_lines_removed"`
   132→
   133→	// UserAddedPerFile tracks per-file user additions for accurate modification tracking.
   134→	// This enables distinguishing user self-modifications from agent modifications.
   135→	// See docs/architecture/attribution.md for details.
   136→	UserAddedPerFile map[string]int `json:"user_added_per_file,omitempty"`
   137→}
   138→
   139→// NormalizeAfterLoad applies backward-compatible migrations to state loaded from disk.
   140→// Call this after deserializing a State from JSON.
   141→func (s *State) NormalizeAfterLoad() {
   142→	// Migrate transcript fields: CheckpointTranscriptStart replaces both
   143→	// CondensedTranscriptLines and TranscriptLinesAtStart from older state files.
   144→	if s.CheckpointTranscriptStart == 0 {
   145→		if s.CondensedTranscriptLines > 0 {
   146→			s.CheckpointTranscriptStart = s.CondensedTranscriptLines
   147→		} else if s.TranscriptLinesAtStart > 0 {
   148→			s.CheckpointTranscriptStart = s.TranscriptLinesAtStart
   149→		}
   150→	}
   151→	// Clear deprecated fields so they aren't re-persisted.
   152→	// Note: this is a one-way migration. If the state is re-saved, older CLI versions
   153→	// will see 0 for these fields and fall back to scoping from the transcript start.
   154→	// This is acceptable since CLI upgrades are monotonic and the worst case is
   155→	// redundant transcript content in a condensation, not data loss.
   156→	s.CondensedTranscriptLines = 0
   157→	s.TranscriptLinesAtStart = 0
   158→}
   159→
   160→// StateStore provides low-level operations for managing session state files.
   161→//
   162→// StateStore is a primitive for session state persistence. It is NOT the same as
   163→// the Sessions interface - it only handles state files in .git/entire-sessions/,
   164→// not the full session data which includes checkpoint content.
   165→//
   166→// Use StateStore directly in strategies for performance-critical state operations.
   167→// Use the Sessions interface (when implemented) for high-level session management.
   168→type StateStore struct {
   169→	// stateDir is the directory where session state files are stored
   170→	stateDir string
   171→}
   172→
   173→// NewStateStore creates a new state store.
   174→// Uses the git common dir to store session state (shared across worktrees).
   175→func NewStateStore() (*StateStore, error) {
   176→	commonDir, err := getGitCommonDir()
   177→	if err != nil {
   178→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get git common dir: %w", err)
   179→	}
   180→	return &StateStore{
   181→		stateDir: filepath.Join(commonDir, SessionStateDirName),
   182→	}, nil
   183→}
   184→
   185→// NewStateStoreWithDir creates a new state store with a custom directory.
   186→// This is useful for testing.
   187→func NewStateStoreWithDir(stateDir string) *StateStore {
   188→	return &StateStore{stateDir: stateDir}
   189→}
   190→
   191→// Load loads the session state for the given session ID.
   192→// Returns (nil, nil) when session file doesn't exist (not an error condition).
   193→func (s *StateStore) Load(ctx context.Context, sessionID string) (*State, error) {
   194→	_ = ctx // Reserved for future use
   195→
   196→	// Validate session ID to prevent path traversal
   197→	if err := validation.ValidateSessionID(sessionID); err != nil {
   198→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("invalid session ID: %w", err)
   199→	}
   200→
   201→	stateFile := s.stateFilePath(sessionID)
   202→
   203→	data, err := os.ReadFile(stateFile) //nolint:gosec // stateFile is derived from sessionID
   204→	if os.IsNotExist(err) {
   205→		return nil, nil //nolint:nilnil // nil,nil indicates session not found (expected case)
   206→	}
   207→	if err != nil {
   208→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to read session state: %w", err)
   209→	}
   210→
   211→	var state State
   212→	if err := json.Unmarshal(data, &state); err != nil {
   213→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to unmarshal session state: %w", err)
   214→	}
   215→	state.NormalizeAfterLoad()
   216→	return &state, nil
   217→}
   218→
   219→// Save saves the session state atomically.
   220→func (s *StateStore) Save(ctx context.Context, state *State) error {
   221→	_ = ctx // Reserved for future use
   222→
   223→	// Validate session ID to prevent path traversal
   224→	if err := validation.ValidateSessionID(state.SessionID); err != nil {
   225→		return fmt.Errorf("invalid session ID: %w", err)
   226→	}
   227→
   228→	if err := os.MkdirAll(s.stateDir, 0o750); err != nil {
   229→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to create session state directory: %w", err)
   230→	}
   231→
   232→	data, err := jsonutil.MarshalIndentWithNewline(state, "", "  ")
   233→	if err != nil {
   234→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to marshal session state: %w", err)
   235→	}
   236→
   237→	stateFile := s.stateFilePath(state.SessionID)
   238→
   239→	// Atomic write: write to temp file, then rename
   240→	tmpFile := stateFile + ".tmp"
   241→	if err := os.WriteFile(tmpFile, data, 0o600); err != nil {
   242→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to write session state: %w", err)
   243→	}
   244→	if err := os.Rename(tmpFile, stateFile); err != nil {
   245→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to rename session state file: %w", err)
   246→	}
   247→	return nil
   248→}
   249→
   250→// Clear removes the session state file for the given session ID.
   251→func (s *StateStore) Clear(ctx context.Context, sessionID string) error {
   252→	_ = ctx // Reserved for future use
   253→
   254→	// Validate session ID to prevent path traversal
   255→	if err := validation.ValidateSessionID(sessionID); err != nil {
   256→		return fmt.Errorf("invalid session ID: %w", err)
   257→	}
   258→
   259→	stateFile := s.stateFilePath(sessionID)
   260→
   261→	if err := os.Remove(stateFile); err != nil {
   262→		if os.IsNotExist(err) {
   263→			return nil // Already gone, not an error
   264→		}
   265→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to remove session state file: %w", err)
   266→	}
   267→	return nil
   268→}
   269→
   270→// RemoveAll removes the entire session state directory.
   271→// This is used during uninstall to completely remove all session state.
   272→func (s *StateStore) RemoveAll() error {
   273→	if err := os.RemoveAll(s.stateDir); err != nil {
   274→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to remove session state directory: %w", err)
   275→	}
   276→	return nil
   277→}
   278→
   279→// List returns all session states.
   280→func (s *StateStore) List(ctx context.Context) ([]*State, error) {
   281→	_ = ctx // Reserved for future use
   282→
   283→	entries, err := os.ReadDir(s.stateDir)
   284→	if os.IsNotExist(err) {
   285→		return nil, nil
   286→	}
   287→	if err != nil {
   288→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to read session state directory: %w", err)
   289→	}
   290→
   291→	var states []*State
   292→	for _, entry := range entries {
   293→		if entry.IsDir() || !strings.HasSuffix(entry.Name(), ".json") {
   294→			continue
   295→		}
   296→		if strings.HasSuffix(entry.Name(), ".tmp") {
   297→			continue // Skip temp files
   298→		}
   299→
   300→		sessionID := strings.TrimSuffix(entry.Name(), ".json")
   301→		state, err := s.Load(ctx, sessionID)
   302→		if err != nil {
   303→			continue // Skip corrupted state files
   304→		}
   305→		if state == nil {
   306→			continue
   307→		}
   308→
   309→		states = append(states, state)
   310→	}
   311→	return states, nil
   312→}
   313→
   314→// stateFilePath returns the path to a session state file.
   315→func (s *StateStore) stateFilePath(sessionID string) string {
   316→	return filepath.Join(s.stateDir, sessionID+".json")
   317→}
   318→
   319→// getGitCommonDir returns the path to the shared git directory.
   320→// In a regular checkout, this is .git/
   321→// In a worktree, this is the main repo's .git/ (not .git/worktrees/<name>/)
   322→func getGitCommonDir() (string, error) {
   323→	ctx := context.Background()
   324→	cmd := exec.CommandContext(ctx, "git", "rev-parse", "--git-common-dir")
   325→	cmd.Dir = "."
   326→	output, err := cmd.Output()
   327→	if err != nil {
   328→		return "", fmt.Errorf("failed to get git common dir: %w", err)
   329→	}
   330→
   331→	commonDir := strings.TrimSpace(string(output))
   332→
   333→	// git rev-parse --git-common-dir returns relative paths from the working directory,
   334→	// so we need to make it absolute if it isn't already
   335→	if !filepath.IsAbs(commonDir) {
   336→		commonDir = filepath.Join(".", commonDir)
   337→	}
   338→
   339→	return filepath.Clean(commonDir), nil
   340→}
   341→

content.text:
I can clearly see the issue. The diff shows:

- Old: `LastInteractionAt *time.Time \`json:"last_interaction_at"\``
- New: `LastInteractionTime *time.Time \`json:"last_interaction_time"\``

Both the Go field name AND the JSON tag changed. Unlike `StepCount` (which kept the old JSON tag `checkpoint_count`) and the transcript fields (which have deprecated fields with migration), `LastInteractionTime` has no backward compat handling. Existing state files with `"last_interaction_at": "..."` will silently lose this value.

The cursor[bot] is correct. Let me fix this by adding a deprecated field with migration in `NormalizeAfterLoad()`.

1→package strategy
     2→
     3→import (
     4→	"context"
     5→	"encoding/json"
     6→	"errors"
     7→	"fmt"
     8→	"log/slog"
     9→	"os"

    11→	"strings"
    12→	"sync"
    13→	"time"

    15→	"github.com/entireio/cli/cmd/entire/cli/agent"

    24→	"github.com/go-git/go-git/v5/plumbing/object"
    25→)
    26→
    27→// isNotFoundError checks if an error represents a "not found" condition in go-git.
    28→// This includes entry not found, file not found, directory not found, and object not found.
    29→func isNotFoundError(err error) bool {
    30→	return errors.Is(err, object.ErrEntryNotFound) ||
    31→		errors.Is(err, object.ErrFileNotFound) ||
    32→		errors.Is(err, object.ErrDirectoryNotFound) ||
    33→		errors.Is(err, plumbing.ErrObjectNotFound) ||
    34→		errors.Is(err, plumbing.ErrReferenceNotFound)
    35→}
    36→
    37→// commitOrHead attempts to create a commit. If the commit would be empty (files already
    38→// committed), it returns HEAD hash instead. This handles the case where files were
    39→// modified during a session but already committed by the user before the hook runs.
    40→func commitOrHead(repo *git.Repository, worktree *git.Worktree, msg string, author *object.Signature) (plumbing.Hash, error) {
    41→	commitHash, err := worktree.Commit(msg, &git.CommitOptions{Author: author})
    42→	if errors.Is(err, git.ErrEmptyCommit) {
    43→		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "No changes to commit (files already committed)\n")
    44→		head, err := repo.Head()
    45→		if err != nil {
    46→			return plumbing.ZeroHash, fmt.Errorf("failed to get HEAD: %w", err)
    47→		}
    48→		return head.Hash(), nil
    49→	}
    50→	if err != nil {
    51→		return plumbing.ZeroHash, fmt.Errorf("failed to commit: %w", err)
    52→	}
    53→	return commitHash, nil
    54→}
    55→
    56→// AutoCommitStrategy implements the auto-commit strategy:
    57→// - Code changes are committed to the active branch (like commit strategy)
    58→// - Session logs are committed to a shadow branch (like manual-commit strategy)
    59→// - Code commits can reference the shadow branch via trailers
    60→type AutoCommitStrategy struct {
    61→	// checkpointStore manages checkpoint data on entire/sessions branch
    62→	checkpointStore *checkpoint.GitStore
    63→	// checkpointStoreOnce ensures thread-safe lazy initialization
    64→	checkpointStoreOnce sync.Once
    65→	// checkpointStoreErr captures any error during initialization
    66→	checkpointStoreErr error
    67→}
    68→
    69→// getCheckpointStore returns the checkpoint store, initializing it lazily if needed.
    70→// Thread-safe via sync.Once.
    71→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) getCheckpointStore() (*checkpoint.GitStore, error) {
    72→	s.checkpointStoreOnce.Do(func() {
    73→		repo, err := OpenRepository()
    74→		if err != nil {
    75→			s.checkpointStoreErr = fmt.Errorf("failed to open repository: %w", err)
    76→			return
    77→		}
    78→		s.checkpointStore = checkpoint.NewGitStore(repo)
    79→	})
    80→	return s.checkpointStore, s.checkpointStoreErr
    81→}
    82→
    83→// NewAutoCommitStrategy creates a new AutoCommitStrategy instance
    84→//
    85→
    86→func NewAutoCommitStrategy() Strategy {
    87→	return &AutoCommitStrategy{}
    88→}
    89→
    90→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) Name() string {
    91→	return StrategyNameAutoCommit
    92→}
    93→
    94→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) Description() string {
    95→	return "Auto-commits code to active branch with metadata on entire/sessions"
    96→}
    97→
    98→// AllowsMainBranch returns true to allow auto-commit strategy on main branch.
    99→// The strategy creates clean commits with Entire-Checkpoint trailers, and detailed
   100→// metadata is stored on the separate entire/sessions orphan branch.
   101→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) AllowsMainBranch() bool {
   102→	return true
   103→}
   104→
   105→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) ValidateRepository() error {
   106→	repo, err := OpenRepository()
   107→	if err != nil {
   108→		return fmt.Errorf("not a git repository: %w", err)
   109→	}
   110→
   111→	_, err = repo.Worktree()
   112→	if err != nil {
   113→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to access worktree: %w", err)
   114→	}
   115→
   116→	return nil
   117→}
   118→
   119→// PrePush is called by the git pre-push hook before pushing to a remote.
   120→// It pushes the entire/sessions branch alongside the user's push.
   121→// Configuration options (stored in .entire/settings.json under strategy_options.push_sessions):
   122→//   - "auto": always push automatically
   123→//   - "prompt" (default): ask user with option to enable auto
   124→//   - "false"/"off"/"no": never push
   125→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) PrePush(remote string) error {
   126→	return pushSessionsBranchCommon(remote, paths.MetadataBranchName)
   127→}
   128→
   129→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) SaveChanges(ctx SaveContext) error {
   130→	repo, err := OpenRepository()
   131→	if err != nil {
   132→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to open git repository: %w", err)
   133→	}
   134→
   135→	// Generate checkpoint ID for this commit
   136→	cpID, err := id.Generate()
   137→	if err != nil {
   138→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to generate checkpoint ID: %w", err)
   139→	}
   140→	// Step 1: Commit code changes to active branch with checkpoint ID trailer
   141→	// We do code first to avoid orphaned metadata if this step fails.
   142→	// If metadata commit fails after this, the code commit exists but GetRewindPoints
   143→	// already handles missing metadata gracefully (skips commits without metadata).
   144→	codeResult, err := s.commitCodeToActive(repo, ctx, cpID)
   145→	if err != nil {
   146→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to commit code to active branch: %w", err)
   147→	}
   148→
   149→	// If no code commit was created (no changes), skip metadata creation
   150→	// This prevents orphaned metadata commits that don't correspond to any code commit
   151→	if !codeResult.Created {
   152→		logCtx := logging.WithComponent(context.Background(), "checkpoint")
   153→		logging.Info(logCtx, "checkpoint skipped (no changes)",
   154→			slog.String("strategy", "auto-commit"),
   155→			slog.String("checkpoint_type", "session"),
   156→		)
   157→		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Skipped checkpoint (no changes since last commit)\n")
   158→		return nil
   159→	}
   160→
   161→	// Step 2: Commit metadata to entire/sessions branch using sharded path
   162→	// Path is <checkpointID[:2]>/<checkpointID[2:]>/ for direct lookup
   163→	_, err = s.commitMetadataToMetadataBranch(repo, ctx, cpID)
   164→	if err != nil {
   165→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to commit metadata to entire/sessions branch: %w", err)
   166→	}
   167→
   168→	// Log checkpoint creation
   169→	logCtx := logging.WithComponent(context.Background(), "checkpoint")
   170→	logging.Info(logCtx, "checkpoint saved",
   171→		slog.String("strategy", "auto-commit"),
   172→		slog.String("checkpoint_type", "session"),
   173→		slog.String("checkpoint_id", cpID.String()),
   174→		slog.Int("modified_files", len(ctx.ModifiedFiles)),
   175→		slog.Int("new_files", len(ctx.NewFiles)),
   176→		slog.Int("deleted_files", len(ctx.DeletedFiles)),
   177→	)
   178→
   179→	return nil
   180→}
   181→
   182→// commitCodeResult contains the result of committing code to the active branch.
   183→type commitCodeResult struct {
   184→	CommitHash plumbing.Hash
   185→	Created    bool // True if a new commit was created, false if skipped (no changes)
   186→}
   187→
   188→// commitCodeToActive commits code changes to the active branch.
   189→// Adds an Entire-Checkpoint trailer for metadata lookup that survives amend/rebase.
   190→// Returns the result containing commit hash and whether a commit was created.
   191→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) commitCodeToActive(repo *git.Repository, ctx SaveContext, checkpointID id.CheckpointID) (commitCodeResult, error) {
   192→	// Check if there are any code changes to commit
   193→	if len(ctx.ModifiedFiles) == 0 && len(ctx.NewFiles) == 0 && len(ctx.DeletedFiles) == 0 {
   194→		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "No code changes to commit to active branch\n")
   195→		// Return current HEAD hash but mark as not created
   196→		head, err := repo.Head()
   197→		if err != nil {
   198→			return commitCodeResult{}, fmt.Errorf("failed to get HEAD: %w", err)
   199→		}
   200→		return commitCodeResult{CommitHash: head.Hash(), Created: false}, nil
   201→	}
   202→
   203→	worktree, err := repo.Worktree()
   204→	if err != nil {
   205→		return commitCodeResult{}, fmt.Errorf("failed to get worktree: %w", err)
   206→	}
   207→
   208→	// Get HEAD hash before commit to detect if commitOrHead actually creates a new commit
   209→	// (commitOrHead returns HEAD hash without error when git.ErrEmptyCommit occurs)
   210→	headBefore, err := repo.Head()
   211→	if err != nil {
   212→		return commitCodeResult{}, fmt.Errorf("failed to get HEAD: %w", err)
   213→	}
   214→
   215→	// Stage code changes
   216→	StageFiles(worktree, ctx.ModifiedFiles, ctx.NewFiles, ctx.DeletedFiles, StageForSession)
   217→
   218→	// Add checkpoint ID trailer to commit message
   219→	commitMsg := ctx.CommitMessage + "\n\n" + trailers.CheckpointTrailerKey + ": " + checkpointID.String()
   220→
   221→	author := &object.Signature{
   222→		Name:  ctx.AuthorName,
   223→		Email: ctx.AuthorEmail,
   224→		When:  time.Now(),
   225→	}
   226→	commitHash, err := commitOrHead(repo, worktree, commitMsg, author)
   227→	if err != nil {
   228→		return commitCodeResult{}, err
   229→	}
   230→
   231→	// Check if a new commit was actually created by comparing with HEAD before
   232→	created := commitHash != headBefore.Hash()
   233→	if created {
   234→		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Committed code changes to active branch (%s)\n", commitHash.String()[:7])
   235→	}
   236→	return commitCodeResult{CommitHash: commitHash, Created: created}, nil
   237→}
   238→
   239→// commitMetadataToMetadataBranch commits session metadata to the entire/sessions branch.
   240→// Metadata is stored at sharded path: <checkpointID[:2]>/<checkpointID[2:]>/
   241→// This allows direct lookup from the checkpoint ID trailer on the code commit.
   242→// Uses checkpoint.WriteCommitted for git operations.
   243→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) commitMetadataToMetadataBranch(repo *git.Repository, ctx SaveContext, checkpointID id.CheckpointID) (plumbing.Hash, error) {
   244→	store, err := s.getCheckpointStore()
   245→	if err != nil {
   246→		return plumbing.ZeroHash, fmt.Errorf("failed to get checkpoint store: %w", err)
   247→	}
   248→
   249→	// Extract session ID from metadata dir
   250→	sessionID := filepath.Base(ctx.MetadataDir)
   251→
   252→	// Get current branch name
   253→	branchName := GetCurrentBranchName(repo)
   254→
   255→	// Combine all file changes into FilesTouched (same as manual-commit)
   256→	filesTouched := mergeFilesTouched(nil, ctx.ModifiedFiles, ctx.NewFiles, ctx.DeletedFiles)
   257→
   258→	// Write committed checkpoint using the checkpoint store
   259→	err = store.WriteCommitted(context.Background(), checkpoint.WriteCommittedOptions{
   260→		CheckpointID:                checkpointID,
   261→		SessionID:                   sessionID,
   262→		Strategy:                    StrategyNameAutoCommit, // Use new strategy name
   263→		Branch:                      branchName,
   264→		MetadataDir:                 ctx.MetadataDirAbs, // Copy all files from metadata dir
   265→		AuthorName:                  ctx.AuthorName,
   266→		AuthorEmail:                 ctx.AuthorEmail,
   267→		Agent:                       ctx.AgentType,
   268→		TranscriptIdentifierAtStart: ctx.TranscriptIdentifierAtStart,
   269→		TranscriptLinesAtStart:      ctx.TranscriptLinesAtStart,
   270→		TokenUsage:                  ctx.TokenUsage,
   271→		CheckpointsCount:            1,            // Each auto-commit checkpoint = 1
   272→		FilesTouched:                filesTouched, // Track modified files (same as manual-commit)
   273→	})
   274→	if err != nil {
   275→		return plumbing.ZeroHash, fmt.Errorf("failed to write committed checkpoint: %w", err)
   276→	}
   277→
   278→	fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Committed session metadata to %s (%s)\n", paths.MetadataBranchName, checkpointID)
   279→	return plumbing.ZeroHash, nil // Commit hash not needed by callers
   280→}
   281→
   282→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) GetRewindPoints(limit int) ([]RewindPoint, error) {
   283→	// For auto-commit strategy, rewind points are found by looking for Entire-Checkpoint trailers
   284→	// in the current branch's commit history. The checkpoint ID provides direct lookup
   285→	// to metadata on entire/sessions branch.
   286→	repo, err := OpenRepository()
   287→	if err != nil {
   288→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to open git repository: %w", err)
   289→	}
   290→
   291→	head, err := repo.Head()
   292→	if err != nil {
   293→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get HEAD: %w", err)
   294→	}
   295→
   296→	// Get metadata branch tree for lookups
   297→	metadataTree, err := GetMetadataBranchTree(repo)
   298→	if err != nil {
   299→		// No metadata branch yet is fine
   300→		return []RewindPoint{}, nil //nolint:nilerr // Expected when no metadata exists
   301→	}
   302→
   303→	// Get the main branch commit hash to determine branch-only commits
   304→	mainBranchHash := GetMainBranchHash(repo)
   305→
   306→	// Walk current branch history looking for commits with checkpoint trailers
   307→	iter, err := repo.Log(&git.LogOptions{
   308→		From:  head.Hash(),
   309→		Order: git.LogOrderCommitterTime,
   310→	})
   311→	if err != nil {
   312→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get commit log: %w", err)
   313→	}
   314→
   315→	var points []RewindPoint
   316→	count := 0
   317→
   318→	err = iter.ForEach(func(c *object.Commit) error {
   319→		if count >= logsOnlyScanLimit || len(points) >= limit {
   320→			return errStop
   321→		}
   322→		count++
   323→
   324→		// Check for Entire-Checkpoint trailer
   325→		cpID, found := trailers.ParseCheckpoint(c.Message)
   326→		if !found {
   327→			return nil
   328→		}
   329→
   330→		// Look up metadata from sharded path
   331→		checkpointPath := cpID.Path()
   332→		metadata, err := ReadCheckpointMetadata(metadataTree, checkpointPath)
   333→		if err != nil {
   334→			// Checkpoint exists in commit but no metadata found - skip this commit
   335→			return nil //nolint:nilerr // Intentional: skip commits without metadata
   336→		}
   337→
   338→		message := strings.Split(c.Message, "\n")[0]
   339→
   340→		// Determine if this is a full rewind or logs-only
   341→		// Full rewind is allowed if commit is only on this branch (not reachable from main)
   342→		isLogsOnly := false
   343→		if mainBranchHash != plumbing.ZeroHash {
   344→			if IsAncestorOf(repo, c.Hash, mainBranchHash) {
   345→				isLogsOnly = true
   346→			}
   347→		}
   348→
   349→		// Build metadata path - for task checkpoints, include the task path
   350→		metadataDir := checkpointPath
   351→		if metadata.IsTask && metadata.ToolUseID != "" {
   352→			metadataDir = checkpointPath + "/tasks/" + metadata.ToolUseID
   353→		}
   354→
   355→		// Read session prompt from metadata tree
   356→		sessionPrompt := ReadSessionPromptFromTree(metadataTree, checkpointPath)
   357→
   358→		points = append(points, RewindPoint{
   359→			ID:               c.Hash.String(),
   360→			Message:          message,
   361→			MetadataDir:      metadataDir,
   362→			Date:             c.Author.When,
   363→			IsLogsOnly:       isLogsOnly,
   364→			CheckpointID:     cpID,
   365→			IsTaskCheckpoint: metadata.IsTask,
   366→			ToolUseID:        metadata.ToolUseID,
   367→			Agent:            metadata.Agent,
   368→			SessionID:        metadata.SessionID,
   369→			SessionPrompt:    sessionPrompt,
   370→		})
   371→
   372→		return nil
   373→	})
   374→
   375→	if err != nil && !errors.Is(err, errStop) {
   376→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to iterate commits: %w", err)
   377→	}
   378→
   379→	return points, nil
   380→}
   381→
   382→// findTaskMetadataPathForCommit looks up the task metadata path for a task checkpoint commit
   383→// by searching the entire/sessions branch commit history for the checkpoint directory.
   384→// Returns ("", nil) if metadata is not found - this is expected for commits without metadata.
   385→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) findTaskMetadataPathForCommit(repo *git.Repository, commitSHA, toolUseID string) (string, error) {
   386→	// Get the entire/sessions branch
   387→	refName := plumbing.NewBranchReferenceName(paths.MetadataBranchName)
   388→	ref, err := repo.Reference(refName, true)
   389→	if err != nil {
   390→		if isNotFoundError(err) {
   391→			return "", nil // No metadata branch yet
   392→		}
   393→		return "", fmt.Errorf("failed to get metadata branch: %w", err)
   394→	}
   395→
   396→	// Search commit history for a commit referencing this code commit SHA and tool use ID
   397→	shortSHA := commitSHA
   398→	if len(shortSHA) > 7 {
   399→		shortSHA = shortSHA[:7]
   400→	}
   401→
   402→	iter, err := repo.Log(&git.LogOptions{From: ref.Hash()})
   403→	if err != nil {
   404→		return "", fmt.Errorf("failed to get commit log: %w", err)
   405→	}
   406→
   407→	var foundTaskPath string
   408→	err = iter.ForEach(func(commit *object.Commit) error {
   409→		// Check if commit message contains "Commit: <sha>" and the tool use ID
   410→		if strings.Contains(commit.Message, "Commit: "+shortSHA) &&
   411→			strings.Contains(commit.Message, toolUseID) {
   412→			// Parse task metadata trailer
   413→			if taskPath, found := trailers.ParseTaskMetadata(commit.Message); found {
   414→				foundTaskPath = taskPath
   415→				return errStop // Found it
   416→			}
   417→		}
   418→		return nil
   419→	})
   420→	if err != nil && !errors.Is(err, errStop) {
   421→		return "", fmt.Errorf("failed to iterate commits: %w", err)
   422→	}
   423→
   424→	return foundTaskPath, nil
   425→}
   426→
   427→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) Rewind(point RewindPoint) error {
   428→	commitHash := plumbing.NewHash(point.ID)
   429→	shortID, err := HardResetWithProtection(commitHash)
   430→	if err != nil {
   431→		return err
   432→	}
   433→
   434→	fmt.Println()
   435→	fmt.Printf("Reset to commit %s\n", shortID)
   436→	fmt.Println()
   437→
   438→	return nil
   439→}
   440→
   441→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) CanRewind() (bool, string, error) {
   442→	return checkCanRewind()
   443→}
   444→
   445→// PreviewRewind returns what will happen if rewinding to the given point.
   446→// For auto-commit strategy, this returns nil since git reset doesn't delete untracked files.
   447→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) PreviewRewind(_ RewindPoint) (*RewindPreview, error) {
   448→	// Auto-commit uses git reset --hard which doesn't affect untracked files
   449→	// Return empty preview to indicate no untracked files will be deleted
   450→	return &RewindPreview{}, nil
   451→}
   452→
   453→// EnsureSetup ensures the strategy's required setup is in place.
   454→// For auto-commit strategy:
   455→// - Ensure .entire/.gitignore has all required entries
   456→// - Create orphan entire/sessions branch if it doesn't exist
   457→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) EnsureSetup() error {
   458→	if err := EnsureEntireGitignore(); err != nil {
   459→		return err
   460→	}
   461→
   462→	repo, err := OpenRepository()
   463→	if err != nil {
   464→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to open git repository: %w", err)
   465→	}
   466→
   467→	// Ensure the entire/sessions orphan branch exists
   468→	if err := EnsureMetadataBranch(repo); err != nil {
   469→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to ensure metadata branch: %w", err)
   470→	}
   471→
   472→	return nil
   473→}
   474→
   475→// GetSessionInfo returns session information for linking commits.
   476→// For auto-commit strategy, we don't track active sessions - metadata is stored on
   477→// entire/sessions branch when SaveChanges is called. Active branch commits
   478→// are kept clean (no trailers), so this returns ErrNoSession.
   479→// Use ListSessions() or GetSession() to retrieve session info from the metadata branch.
   480→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) GetSessionInfo() (*SessionInfo, error) {
   481→	// Dual strategy doesn't track active sessions like shadow does.
   482→	// Session metadata is stored on entire/sessions branch and can be
   483→	// retrieved via ListSessions() or GetSession().
   484→	return nil, ErrNoSession
   485→}
   486→
   487→// SaveTaskCheckpoint creates a checkpoint commit for a completed task.
   488→// For auto-commit strategy:
   489→// 1. Commit code changes to active branch (no trailers - clean history)
   490→// 2. Commit task metadata to entire/sessions branch with checkpoint format
   491→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) SaveTaskCheckpoint(ctx TaskCheckpointContext) error {
   492→	repo, err := OpenRepository()
   493→	if err != nil {
   494→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to open git repository: %w", err)
   495→	}
   496→
   497→	// Ensure entire/sessions branch exists
   498→	if err := EnsureMetadataBranch(repo); err != nil {
   499→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to ensure metadata branch: %w", err)
   500→	}
   501→
   502→	// Generate checkpoint ID for this task checkpoint
   503→	cpID, err := id.Generate()
   504→	if err != nil {
   505→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to generate checkpoint ID: %w", err)
   506→	}
   507→
   508→	// Step 1: Commit code changes to active branch with checkpoint ID trailer
   509→	// We do code first to avoid orphaned metadata if this step fails.
   510→	_, err = s.commitTaskCodeToActive(repo, ctx, cpID)
   511→	if err != nil {
   512→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to commit task code to active branch: %w", err)
   513→	}
   514→
   515→	// Step 2: Commit task metadata to entire/sessions branch at sharded path
   516→	_, err = s.commitTaskMetadataToMetadataBranch(repo, ctx, cpID)
   517→	if err != nil {
   518→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to commit task metadata to entire/sessions branch: %w", err)
   519→	}
   520→
   521→	// Log task checkpoint creation
   522→	logCtx := logging.WithComponent(context.Background(), "checkpoint")
   523→	attrs := []any{
   524→		slog.String("strategy", "auto-commit"),
   525→		slog.String("checkpoint_type", "task"),
   526→		slog.String("checkpoint_id", cpID.String()),
   527→		slog.String("checkpoint_uuid", ctx.CheckpointUUID),
   528→		slog.String("tool_use_id", ctx.ToolUseID),
   529→		slog.String("subagent_type", ctx.SubagentType),
   530→		slog.Int("modified_files", len(ctx.ModifiedFiles)),
   531→		slog.Int("new_files", len(ctx.NewFiles)),
   532→		slog.Int("deleted_files", len(ctx.DeletedFiles)),
   533→	}
   534→	if ctx.IsIncremental {
   535→		attrs = append(attrs,
   536→			slog.Bool("is_incremental", true),
   537→			slog.String("incremental_type", ctx.IncrementalType),
   538→			slog.Int("incremental_sequence", ctx.IncrementalSequence),
   539→		)
   540→	}
   541→	logging.Info(logCtx, "task checkpoint saved", attrs...)
   542→
   543→	return nil
   544→}
   545→
   546→// commitTaskCodeToActive commits task code changes to the active branch.
   547→// Adds an Entire-Checkpoint trailer for metadata lookup that survives amend/rebase.
   548→// Skips commit creation if there are no file changes.
   549→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) commitTaskCodeToActive(repo *git.Repository, ctx TaskCheckpointContext, checkpointID id.CheckpointID) (plumbing.Hash, error) {
   550→	hasFileChanges := len(ctx.ModifiedFiles) > 0 || len(ctx.NewFiles) > 0 || len(ctx.DeletedFiles) > 0
   551→
   552→	// If no file changes, skip code commit
   553→	if !hasFileChanges {
   554→		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "No code changes to commit for task checkpoint\n")
   555→		// Return current HEAD hash so metadata can still be stored
   556→		head, err := repo.Head()
   557→		if err != nil {
   558→			return plumbing.ZeroHash, fmt.Errorf("failed to get HEAD: %w", err)
   559→		}
   560→		return head.Hash(), nil
   561→	}
   562→
   563→	worktree, err := repo.Worktree()
   564→	if err != nil {
   565→		return plumbing.ZeroHash, fmt.Errorf("failed to get worktree: %w", err)
   566→	}
   567→
   568→	// Stage code changes
   569→	StageFiles(worktree, ctx.ModifiedFiles, ctx.NewFiles, ctx.DeletedFiles, StageForTask)
   570→
   571→	// Build commit message with checkpoint trailer
   572→	shortToolUseID := ctx.ToolUseID
   573→	if len(shortToolUseID) > 12 {
   574→		shortToolUseID = shortToolUseID[:12]
   575→	}
   576→
   577→	var subject string
   578→	if ctx.IsIncremental {
   579→		subject = FormatIncrementalSubject(
   580→			ctx.IncrementalType,
   581→			ctx.SubagentType,
   582→			ctx.TaskDescription,
   583→			ctx.TodoContent,
   584→			ctx.IncrementalSequence,
   585→			shortToolUseID,
   586→		)
   587→	} else {
   588→		subject = FormatSubagentEndMessage(ctx.SubagentType, ctx.TaskDescription, shortToolUseID)
   589→	}
   590→
   591→	// Add checkpoint ID trailer to commit message
   592→	commitMsg := subject + "\n\n" + trailers.CheckpointTrailerKey + ": " + checkpointID.String()
   593→
   594→	author := &object.Signature{
   595→		Name:  ctx.AuthorName,
   596→		Email: ctx.AuthorEmail,
   597→		When:  time.Now(),
   598→	}
   599→
   600→	commitHash, err := commitOrHead(repo, worktree, commitMsg, author)
   601→	if err != nil {
   602→		return plumbing.ZeroHash, err
   603→	}
   604→
   605→	if ctx.IsIncremental {
   606→		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Committed incremental checkpoint #%d to active branch (%s)\n", ctx.IncrementalSequence, commitHash.String()[:7])
   607→	} else {
   608→		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Committed task checkpoint to active branch (%s)\n", commitHash.String()[:7])
   609→	}
   610→	return commitHash, nil
   611→}
   612→
   613→// commitTaskMetadataToMetadataBranch commits task metadata to the entire/sessions branch.
   614→// Uses sharded path: <checkpointID[:2]>/<checkpointID[2:]>/tasks/<tool-use-id>/
   615→// Returns the metadata commit hash.
   616→// When IsIncremental is true, only writes the incremental checkpoint file, skipping transcripts.
   617→// Uses checkpoint.WriteCommitted for git operations.
   618→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) commitTaskMetadataToMetadataBranch(repo *git.Repository, ctx TaskCheckpointContext, checkpointID id.CheckpointID) (plumbing.Hash, error) {
   619→	store, err := s.getCheckpointStore()
   620→	if err != nil {
   621→		return plumbing.ZeroHash, fmt.Errorf("failed to get checkpoint store: %w", err)
   622→	}
   623→
   624→	// Format commit subject line for better git log readability
   625→	shortToolUseID := ctx.ToolUseID
   626→	if len(shortToolUseID) > 12 {
   627→		shortToolUseID = shortToolUseID[:12]
   628→	}
   629→
   630→	var messageSubject string
   631→	if ctx.IsIncremental {
   632→		messageSubject = FormatIncrementalSubject(
   633→			ctx.IncrementalType,
   634→			ctx.SubagentType,
   635→			ctx.TaskDescription,
   636→			ctx.TodoContent,
   637→			ctx.IncrementalSequence,
   638→			shortToolUseID,
   639→		)
   640→	} else {
   641→		messageSubject = FormatSubagentEndMessage(ctx.SubagentType, ctx.TaskDescription, shortToolUseID)
   642→	}
   643→
   644→	// Get current branch name
   645→	branchName := GetCurrentBranchName(repo)
   646→
   647→	// Write committed checkpoint using the checkpoint store
   648→	err = store.WriteCommitted(context.Background(), checkpoint.WriteCommittedOptions{
   649→		CheckpointID:           checkpointID,
   650→		SessionID:              ctx.SessionID,
   651→		Strategy:               StrategyNameAutoCommit,
   652→		Branch:                 branchName,
   653→		IsTask:                 true,
   654→		ToolUseID:              ctx.ToolUseID,
   655→		AgentID:                ctx.AgentID,
   656→		CheckpointUUID:         ctx.CheckpointUUID,
   657→		TranscriptPath:         ctx.TranscriptPath,
   658→		SubagentTranscriptPath: ctx.SubagentTranscriptPath,
   659→		IsIncremental:          ctx.IsIncremental,
   660→		IncrementalSequence:    ctx.IncrementalSequence,
   661→		IncrementalType:        ctx.IncrementalType,
   662→		IncrementalData:        ctx.IncrementalData,
   663→		CommitSubject:          messageSubject,
   664→		AuthorName:             ctx.AuthorName,
   665→		AuthorEmail:            ctx.AuthorEmail,
   666→		Agent:                  ctx.AgentType,
   667→	})
   668→	if err != nil {
   669→		return plumbing.ZeroHash, fmt.Errorf("failed to write task checkpoint: %w", err)
   670→	}
   671→
   672→	if ctx.IsIncremental {
   673→		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Committed incremental checkpoint metadata to %s (%s)\n", paths.MetadataBranchName, checkpointID)
   674→	} else {
   675→		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Committed task metadata to %s (%s)\n", paths.MetadataBranchName, checkpointID)
   676→	}
   677→	return plumbing.ZeroHash, nil // Commit hash not needed by callers
   678→}
   679→
   680→// GetTaskCheckpoint returns the task checkpoint for a given rewind point.
   681→// For auto-commit strategy, checkpoints are stored on the entire/sessions branch in checkpoint directories.
   682→// Returns ErrNotTaskCheckpoint if the point is not a task checkpoint.
   683→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) GetTaskCheckpoint(point RewindPoint) (*TaskCheckpoint, error) {
   684→	if !point.IsTaskCheckpoint {
   685→		return nil, ErrNotTaskCheckpoint
   686→	}
   687→
   688→	repo, err := OpenRepository()
   689→	if err != nil {
   690→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to open repository: %w", err)
   691→	}
   692→
   693→	// Get the entire/sessions branch
   694→	refName := plumbing.NewBranchReferenceName(paths.MetadataBranchName)
   695→	ref, err := repo.Reference(refName, true)
   696→	if err != nil {
   697→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("metadata branch %s not found: %w", paths.MetadataBranchName, err)
   698→	}
   699→
   700→	metadataCommit, err := repo.CommitObject(ref.Hash())
   701→	if err != nil {
   702→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get metadata branch commit: %w", err)
   703→	}
   704→
   705→	tree, err := metadataCommit.Tree()
   706→	if err != nil {
   707→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get metadata tree: %w", err)
   708→	}
   709→
   710→	// Find checkpoint using the metadata path from rewind point
   711→	// MetadataDir for auto-commit task checkpoints is: cond-YYYYMMDD-HHMMSS-XXXXXXXX/tasks/<tool-use-id>
   712→	checkpointPath := point.MetadataDir + "/checkpoint.json"
   713→	file, err := tree.File(checkpointPath)
   714→	if err != nil {
   715→		// Try finding via commit SHA lookup
   716→		taskCheckpointPath, findErr := s.findTaskCheckpointPath(repo, point.ID, point.ToolUseID)
   717→		if findErr != nil {
   718→			return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to find checkpoint at %s: %w", checkpointPath, err)
   719→		}
   720→		file, err = tree.File(taskCheckpointPath)
   721→		if err != nil {
   722→			return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to find checkpoint at %s: %w", taskCheckpointPath, err)
   723→		}
   724→	}
   725→
   726→	content, err := file.Contents()
   727→	if err != nil {
   728→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to read checkpoint: %w", err)
   729→	}
   730→
   731→	var checkpoint TaskCheckpoint
   732→	if err := json.Unmarshal([]byte(content), &checkpoint); err != nil {
   733→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to parse checkpoint: %w", err)
   734→	}
   735→
   736→	return &checkpoint, nil
   737→}
   738→
   739→// GetTaskCheckpointTranscript returns the session transcript for a task checkpoint.
   740→// For auto-commit strategy, transcripts are stored on the entire/sessions branch in checkpoint directories.
   741→// Returns ErrNotTaskCheckpoint if the point is not a task checkpoint.
   742→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) GetTaskCheckpointTranscript(point RewindPoint) ([]byte, error) {
   743→	if !point.IsTaskCheckpoint {
   744→		return nil, ErrNotTaskCheckpoint
   745→	}
   746→
   747→	repo, err := OpenRepository()
   748→	if err != nil {
   749→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to open repository: %w", err)
   750→	}
   751→
   752→	// Get the entire/sessions branch
   753→	refName := plumbing.NewBranchReferenceName(paths.MetadataBranchName)
   754→	ref, err := repo.Reference(refName, true)
   755→	if err != nil {
   756→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("metadata branch %s not found: %w", paths.MetadataBranchName, err)
   757→	}
   758→
   759→	metadataCommit, err := repo.CommitObject(ref.Hash())
   760→	if err != nil {
   761→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get metadata branch commit: %w", err)
   762→	}
   763→
   764→	tree, err := metadataCommit.Tree()
   765→	if err != nil {
   766→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get metadata tree: %w", err)
   767→	}
   768→
   769→	// MetadataDir for auto-commit task checkpoints is: <id[:2]>/<id[2:]>/tasks/<tool-use-id>
   770→	// Extract the checkpoint path by removing "/tasks/<tool-use-id>"
   771→	metadataDir := point.MetadataDir
   772→	if idx := strings.Index(metadataDir, "/tasks/"); idx > 0 {
   773→		checkpointPath := metadataDir[:idx]
   774→
   775→		// Use the first session's transcript path from sessions array
   776→		transcriptPath := ""
   777→		summaryFile, summaryErr := tree.File(checkpointPath + "/" + paths.MetadataFileName)
   778→		if summaryErr == nil {
   779→			summaryContent, contentErr := summaryFile.Contents()
   780→			if contentErr == nil {
   781→				var summary checkpoint.CheckpointSummary
   782→				if json.Unmarshal([]byte(summaryContent), &summary) == nil && len(summary.Sessions) > 0 {
   783→					// Use first session's transcript path (task checkpoints have only one session)
   784→					// SessionFilePaths now contains absolute paths with leading "/"
   785→					// Strip the leading "/" for tree.File() which expects paths without leading slash
   786→					if summary.Sessions[0].Transcript != "" {
   787→						transcriptPath = strings.TrimPrefix(summary.Sessions[0].Transcript, "/")
   788→					}
   789→				}
   790→			}
   791→		}
   792→
   793→		// Fall back to old format if sessions map not available
   794→		if transcriptPath == "" {
   795→			transcriptPath = checkpointPath + "/" + paths.TranscriptFileName
   796→		}
   797→
   798→		file, err := tree.File(transcriptPath)
   799→		if err != nil {
   800→			return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to find transcript at %s: %w", transcriptPath, err)
   801→		}
   802→		content, err := file.Contents()
   803→		if err != nil {
   804→			return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to read transcript: %w", err)
   805→		}
   806→		return []byte(content), nil
   807→	}
   808→
   809→	return nil, fmt.Errorf("invalid metadata path format: %s", metadataDir)
   810→}
   811→
   812→// findTaskCheckpointPath finds the full path to a task checkpoint on the entire/sessions branch.
   813→// Searches checkpoint directories for the task checkpoint matching the commit SHA and tool use ID.
   814→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) findTaskCheckpointPath(repo *git.Repository, commitSHA, toolUseID string) (string, error) {
   815→	// Use findTaskMetadataPathForCommit which searches commit history
   816→	taskPath, err := s.findTaskMetadataPathForCommit(repo, commitSHA, toolUseID)
   817→	if err != nil {
   818→		return "", err
   819→	}
   820→	if taskPath == "" {
   821→		return "", errors.New("task checkpoint not found")
   822→	}
   823→	// taskPath is like: cond-YYYYMMDD-HHMMSS-XXXXXXXX/tasks/<tool-use-id>/checkpoints/001-<tool-use-id>.json
   824→	// We need: cond-YYYYMMDD-HHMMSS-XXXXXXXX/tasks/<tool-use-id>/checkpoint.json
   825→	if idx := strings.Index(taskPath, "/checkpoints/"); idx > 0 {
   826→		return taskPath[:idx] + "/checkpoint.json", nil
   827→	}
   828→	return taskPath + "/checkpoint.json", nil
   829→}
   830→
   831→// GetMetadataRef returns a reference to the metadata for the given checkpoint.
   832→// For auto-commit strategy, returns the checkpoint path on entire/sessions branch.
   833→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) GetMetadataRef(checkpoint Checkpoint) string {
   834→	if checkpoint.CheckpointID.IsEmpty() {
   835→		return ""
   836→	}
   837→	return paths.MetadataBranchName + ":" + checkpoint.CheckpointID.Path()
   838→}
   839→
   840→// GetSessionMetadataRef returns a reference to the most recent metadata for a session.
   841→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) GetSessionMetadataRef(sessionID string) string {
   842→	session, err := GetSession(sessionID)
   843→	if err != nil || len(session.Checkpoints) == 0 {
   844→		return ""
   845→	}
   846→	// Checkpoints are ordered with most recent first
   847→	return s.GetMetadataRef(session.Checkpoints[0])
   848→}
   849→
   850→// GetSessionContext returns the context.md content for a session.
   851→// For auto-commit strategy, reads from the entire/sessions branch using the checkpoint store.
   852→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) GetSessionContext(sessionID string) string {
   853→	session, err := GetSession(sessionID)
   854→	if err != nil || len(session.Checkpoints) == 0 {
   855→		return ""
   856→	}
   857→
   858→	// Get the most recent checkpoint
   859→	cp := session.Checkpoints[0]
   860→	if cp.CheckpointID.IsEmpty() {
   861→		return ""
   862→	}
   863→
   864→	store, err := s.getCheckpointStore()
   865→	if err != nil {
   866→		return ""
   867→	}
   868→
   869→	content, err := store.ReadSessionContentByID(context.Background(), cp.CheckpointID, sessionID)
   870→	if err != nil || content == nil {
   871→		return ""
   872→	}
   873→
   874→	return content.Context
   875→}
   876→
   877→// GetCheckpointLog returns the session transcript for a specific checkpoint.
   878→// For auto-commit strategy, looks up checkpoint by ID on the entire/sessions branch using the checkpoint store.
   879→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) GetCheckpointLog(cp Checkpoint) ([]byte, error) {
   880→	if cp.CheckpointID.IsEmpty() {
   881→		return nil, ErrNoMetadata
   882→	}
   883→
   884→	store, err := s.getCheckpointStore()
   885→	if err != nil {
   886→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get checkpoint store: %w", err)
   887→	}
   888→
   889→	content, err := store.ReadLatestSessionContent(context.Background(), cp.CheckpointID)
   890→	if err != nil {
   891→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to read checkpoint: %w", err)
   892→	}
   893→	if content == nil {
   894→		return nil, ErrNoMetadata
   895→	}
   896→
   897→	return content.Transcript, nil
   898→}
   899→
   900→// InitializeSession creates session state for a new session.
   901→// This is called during UserPromptSubmit hook to set up tracking for the session.
   902→// For auto-commit strategy, this creates a SessionState file in .git/entire-sessions/
   903→// to track CondensedTranscriptLines (transcript offset) across checkpoints.
   904→// agentType is the human-readable name of the agent (e.g., "Claude Code").
   905→// transcriptPath is the path to the live transcript file (for mid-session commit detection).
   906→// userPrompt is the user's prompt text (stored truncated as FirstPrompt for display).
   907→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) InitializeSession(sessionID string, agentType agent.AgentType, transcriptPath string, userPrompt string) error {
   908→	repo, err := OpenRepository()
   909→	if err != nil {
   910→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to open git repository: %w", err)
   911→	}
   912→
   913→	// Get current HEAD commit to track as base
   914→	head, err := repo.Head()
   915→	if err != nil {
   916→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to get HEAD: %w", err)
   917→	}
   918→
   919→	baseCommit := head.Hash().String()
   920→
   921→	// Check if session state already exists (e.g., session resuming)
   922→	existing, err := LoadSessionState(sessionID)
   923→	if err != nil {
   924→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to check existing session state: %w", err)
   925→	}
   926→	if existing != nil {
   927→		// Session already initialized — update last interaction time on every prompt submit
   928→		now := time.Now()
   929→		existing.LastInteractionAt = &now
   930→
   931→		// Backfill FirstPrompt if empty (for sessions
   932→		// created before the first_prompt field was added, or resumed sessions)
   933→		if existing.FirstPrompt == "" && userPrompt != "" {
   934→			existing.FirstPrompt = truncatePromptForStorage(userPrompt)
   935→		}
   936→
   937→		if err := SaveSessionState(existing); err != nil {
   938→			return fmt.Errorf("failed to update session state: %w", err)
   939→		}
   940→		return nil
   941→	}
   942→
   943→	// Create new session state
   944→	now := time.Now()
   945→	state := &SessionState{
   946→		SessionID:                sessionID,
   947→		BaseCommit:               baseCommit,
   948→		StartedAt:                now,
   949→		LastInteractionAt:        &now,
   950→		CheckpointCount:          0,
   951→		CondensedTranscriptLines: 0, // Start from beginning of transcript
   952→		FilesTouched:             []string{},
   953→		AgentType:                agentType,
   954→		TranscriptPath:           transcriptPath,
   955→		FirstPrompt:              truncatePromptForStorage(userPrompt),
   956→	}
   957→
   958→	if err := SaveSessionState(state); err != nil {
   959→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to save session state: %w", err)
   960→	}
   961→
   962→	return nil
   963→}
   964→
   965→// ListOrphanedItems returns orphaned items created by the auto-commit strategy.
   966→// For auto-commit, checkpoints are orphaned when no commit has an Entire-Checkpoint
   967→// trailer referencing them (e.g., after rebasing or squashing).
   968→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) ListOrphanedItems() ([]CleanupItem, error) {
   969→	repo, err := OpenRepository()
   970→	if err != nil {
   971→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to open repository: %w", err)
   972→	}
   973→
   974→	// Get checkpoint store (lazily initialized)
   975→	cpStore, err := s.getCheckpointStore()
   976→	if err != nil {
   977→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get checkpoint store: %w", err)
   978→	}
   979→
   980→	// Get all checkpoints from entire/sessions branch
   981→	checkpoints, err := cpStore.ListCommitted(context.Background())
   982→	if err != nil {
   983→		return []CleanupItem{}, nil //nolint:nilerr // No checkpoints is not an error for cleanup
   984→	}
   985→
   986→	if len(checkpoints) == 0 {
   987→		return []CleanupItem{}, nil
   988→	}
   989→
   990→	// Filter to only auto-commit checkpoints (identified by strategy in metadata)
   991→	autoCommitCheckpoints := make(map[string]bool)
   992→	for _, cp := range checkpoints {
   993→		summary, readErr := cpStore.ReadCommitted(context.Background(), cp.CheckpointID)
   994→		if readErr != nil || summary == nil {
   995→			continue
   996→		}
   997→		// Only consider checkpoints created by this strategy
   998→		if summary.Strategy == StrategyNameAutoCommit {
   999→			autoCommitCheckpoints[cp.CheckpointID.String()] = true
  1000→		}
  1001→	}
  1002→
  1003→	if len(autoCommitCheckpoints) == 0 {
  1004→		return []CleanupItem{}, nil
  1005→	}
  1006→
  1007→	// Find checkpoint IDs referenced in commits
  1008→	referencedCheckpoints := s.findReferencedCheckpoints(repo)
  1009→
  1010→	// Find orphaned checkpoints
  1011→	var items []CleanupItem
  1012→	for checkpointID := range autoCommitCheckpoints {
  1013→		if !referencedCheckpoints[checkpointID] {
  1014→			items = append(items, CleanupItem{
  1015→				Type:   CleanupTypeCheckpoint,
  1016→				ID:     checkpointID,
  1017→				Reason: "no commit references this checkpoint",
  1018→			})
  1019→		}
  1020→	}
  1021→
  1022→	return items, nil
  1023→}
  1024→
  1025→// findReferencedCheckpoints scans commits for Entire-Checkpoint trailers.
  1026→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) findReferencedCheckpoints(repo *git.Repository) map[string]bool {
  1027→	referenced := make(map[string]bool)
  1028→
  1029→	refs, err := repo.References()
  1030→	if err != nil {
  1031→		return referenced
  1032→	}
  1033→
  1034→	visited := make(map[plumbing.Hash]bool)
  1035→
  1036→	_ = refs.ForEach(func(ref *plumbing.Reference) error { //nolint:errcheck // Best effort
  1037→		if !ref.Name().IsBranch() {
  1038→			return nil
  1039→		}
  1040→		// Skip entire/* branches
  1041→		branchName := strings.TrimPrefix(ref.Name().String(), "refs/heads/")
  1042→		if strings.HasPrefix(branchName, "entire/") {
  1043→			return nil
  1044→		}
  1045→
  1046→		iter, iterErr := repo.Log(&git.LogOptions{From: ref.Hash()})
  1047→		if iterErr != nil {
  1048→			return nil //nolint:nilerr // Best effort
  1049→		}
  1050→
  1051→		count := 0
  1052→		_ = iter.ForEach(func(c *object.Commit) error { //nolint:errcheck // Best effort
  1053→			count++
  1054→			if count > 1000 {
  1055→				return errors.New("limit reached")
  1056→			}
  1057→			if visited[c.Hash] {
  1058→				return nil
  1059→			}
  1060→			visited[c.Hash] = true
  1061→
  1062→			if cpID, found := trailers.ParseCheckpoint(c.Message); found {
  1063→				referenced[cpID.String()] = true
  1064→			}
  1065→			return nil
  1066→		})
  1067→		return nil
  1068→	})
  1069→
  1070→	return referenced
  1071→}
  1072→
  1073→//nolint:gochecknoinits // Standard pattern for strategy registration
  1074→func init() {
  1075→	// Register auto-commit as the primary strategy name
  1076→	Register(StrategyNameAutoCommit, NewAutoCommitStrategy)
  1077→}
  1078→

    11→// ManualCommitStrategy implements the manual-commit strategy for session management.
    12→// It stores checkpoints on shadow branches and condenses session logs to a
    13→// permanent sessions branch when the user commits.
    14→type ManualCommitStrategy struct {
    15→	// stateStore manages session state files in .git/entire-sessions/
    16→	stateStore *session.StateStore
    17→	// stateStoreOnce ensures thread-safe lazy initialization
    18→	stateStoreOnce sync.Once
    19→	// stateStoreErr captures any error during initialization
    20→	stateStoreErr error
    21→
    22→	// checkpointStore manages checkpoint data in git
    23→	checkpointStore *checkpoint.GitStore
    24→	// checkpointStoreOnce ensures thread-safe lazy initialization
    25→	checkpointStoreOnce sync.Once
    26→	// checkpointStoreErr captures any error during initialization
    27→	checkpointStoreErr error
    28→}
    29→
    30→// getStateStore returns the session state store, initializing it lazily if needed.
    31→// Thread-safe via sync.Once.
    32→func (s *ManualCommitStrategy) getStateStore() (*session.StateStore, error) {
    33→	s.stateStoreOnce.Do(func() {
    34→		store, err := session.NewStateStore()
    35→		if err != nil {
    36→			s.stateStoreErr = fmt.Errorf("failed to create state store: %w", err)
    37→			return
    38→		}
    39→		s.stateStore = store
    40→	})
    41→	return s.stateStore, s.stateStoreErr
    42→}
    43→
    44→// getCheckpointStore returns the checkpoint store, initializing it lazily if needed.
    45→// Thread-safe via sync.Once.
    46→func (s *ManualCommitStrategy) getCheckpointStore() (*checkpoint.GitStore, error) {
    47→	s.checkpointStoreOnce.Do(func() {
    48→		repo, err := OpenRepository()
    49→		if err != nil {
    50→			s.checkpointStoreErr = fmt.Errorf("failed to open repository: %w", err)
    51→			return
    52→		}
    53→		s.checkpointStore = checkpoint.NewGitStore(repo)
    54→	})
    55→	return s.checkpointStore, s.checkpointStoreErr
    56→}

    58→// sessionStateToStrategy converts session.State to strategy.SessionState.
    59→func sessionStateToStrategy(state *session.State) *SessionState {
    60→	if state == nil {
    61→		return nil
    62→	}
    63→	result := &SessionState{
    64→		SessionID:                   state.SessionID,
    65→		BaseCommit:                  state.BaseCommit,
    66→		WorktreePath:                state.WorktreePath,
    67→		WorktreeID:                  state.WorktreeID,
    68→		StartedAt:                   state.StartedAt,
    69→		EndedAt:                     state.EndedAt,
    70→		LastInteractionAt:           state.LastInteractionAt,
    71→		CheckpointCount:             state.CheckpointCount,
    72→		CondensedTranscriptLines:    state.CondensedTranscriptLines,
    73→		UntrackedFilesAtStart:       state.UntrackedFilesAtStart,
    74→		FilesTouched:                state.FilesTouched,
    75→		LastCheckpointID:            state.LastCheckpointID,
    76→		AgentType:                   state.AgentType,
    77→		TokenUsage:                  state.TokenUsage,
    78→		TranscriptLinesAtStart:      state.TranscriptLinesAtStart,
    79→		TranscriptIdentifierAtStart: state.TranscriptIdentifierAtStart,
    80→		TranscriptPath:              state.TranscriptPath,
    81→		FirstPrompt:                 state.FirstPrompt,
    82→	}
    83→	// Convert PromptAttributions
    84→	for _, pa := range state.PromptAttributions {
    85→		result.PromptAttributions = append(result.PromptAttributions, PromptAttribution{
    86→			CheckpointNumber:  pa.CheckpointNumber,
    87→			UserLinesAdded:    pa.UserLinesAdded,
    88→			UserLinesRemoved:  pa.UserLinesRemoved,
    89→			AgentLinesAdded:   pa.AgentLinesAdded,
    90→			AgentLinesRemoved: pa.AgentLinesRemoved,
    91→			UserAddedPerFile:  pa.UserAddedPerFile,
    92→		})
    93→	}
    94→	// Convert PendingPromptAttribution
    95→	if state.PendingPromptAttribution != nil {
    96→		result.PendingPromptAttribution = &PromptAttribution{
    97→			CheckpointNumber:  state.PendingPromptAttribution.CheckpointNumber,
    98→			UserLinesAdded:    state.PendingPromptAttribution.UserLinesAdded,
    99→			UserLinesRemoved:  state.PendingPromptAttribution.UserLinesRemoved,
   100→			AgentLinesAdded:   state.PendingPromptAttribution.AgentLinesAdded,
   101→			AgentLinesRemoved: state.PendingPromptAttribution.AgentLinesRemoved,
   102→			UserAddedPerFile:  state.PendingPromptAttribution.UserAddedPerFile,
   103→		}
   104→	}
   105→	return result
   106→}

   108→// sessionStateFromStrategy converts strategy.SessionState to session.State.
   109→func sessionStateFromStrategy(state *SessionState) *session.State {
   110→	if state == nil {
   111→		return nil
   112→	}
   113→	result := &session.State{
   114→		SessionID:                   state.SessionID,
   115→		BaseCommit:                  state.BaseCommit,
   116→		WorktreePath:                state.WorktreePath,

   118→		StartedAt:                   state.StartedAt,
   119→		EndedAt:                     state.EndedAt,
   120→		LastInteractionAt:           state.LastInteractionAt,
   121→		CheckpointCount:             state.CheckpointCount,
   122→		CondensedTranscriptLines:    state.CondensedTranscriptLines,
   123→		UntrackedFilesAtStart:       state.UntrackedFilesAtStart,
   124→		FilesTouched:                state.FilesTouched,
   125→		LastCheckpointID:            state.LastCheckpointID,
   126→		AgentType:                   state.AgentType,
   127→		TokenUsage:                  state.TokenUsage,
   128→		TranscriptLinesAtStart:      state.TranscriptLinesAtStart,
   129→		TranscriptIdentifierAtStart: state.TranscriptIdentifierAtStart,
   130→		TranscriptPath:              state.TranscriptPath,
   131→		FirstPrompt:                 state.FirstPrompt,
   132→	}
   133→	// Convert PromptAttributions
   134→	for _, pa := range state.PromptAttributions {
   135→		result.PromptAttributions = append(result.PromptAttributions, session.PromptAttribution{
   136→			CheckpointNumber:  pa.CheckpointNumber,
   137→			UserLinesAdded:    pa.UserLinesAdded,
   138→			UserLinesRemoved:  pa.UserLinesRemoved,
   139→			AgentLinesAdded:   pa.AgentLinesAdded,
   140→			AgentLinesRemoved: pa.AgentLinesRemoved,
   141→			UserAddedPerFile:  pa.UserAddedPerFile,
   142→		})
   143→	}
   144→	// Convert PendingPromptAttribution
   145→	if state.PendingPromptAttribution != nil {
   146→		result.PendingPromptAttribution = &session.PromptAttribution{
   147→			CheckpointNumber:  state.PendingPromptAttribution.CheckpointNumber,
   148→			UserLinesAdded:    state.PendingPromptAttribution.UserLinesAdded,
   149→			UserLinesRemoved:  state.PendingPromptAttribution.UserLinesRemoved,
   150→			AgentLinesAdded:   state.PendingPromptAttribution.AgentLinesAdded,
   151→			AgentLinesRemoved: state.PendingPromptAttribution.AgentLinesRemoved,
   152→			UserAddedPerFile:  state.PendingPromptAttribution.UserAddedPerFile,
   153→		}
   154→	}
   155→	return result
   156→}

   190→// ValidateRepository validates that the repository is suitable for this strategy.
   191→func (s *ManualCommitStrategy) ValidateRepository() error {
   192→	repo, err := OpenRepository()
   193→	if err != nil {
   194→		return fmt.Errorf("not a git repository: %w", err)
   195→	}
   196→
   197→	_, err = repo.Worktree()
   198→	if err != nil {
   199→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to access worktree: %w", err)
   200→	}
   201→
   202→	return nil
   203→}
   204→
   205→// EnsureSetup ensures the strategy is properly set up.
   206→func (s *ManualCommitStrategy) EnsureSetup() error {
   207→	if err := EnsureEntireGitignore(); err != nil {
   208→		return err
   209→	}
   210→
   211→	// Ensure the entire/sessions orphan branch exists for permanent session storage
   212→	repo, err := OpenRepository()
   213→	if err != nil {
   214→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to open git repository: %w", err)
   215→	}
   216→	if err := EnsureMetadataBranch(repo); err != nil {
   217→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to ensure metadata branch: %w", err)
   218→	}
   219→
   220→	// Install generic hooks (they delegate to strategy at runtime)
   221→	if !IsGitHookInstalled() {
   222→		_, err := InstallGitHook(true)
   223→		return err
   224→	}
   225→	return nil
   226→}
   227→
   228→// ListOrphanedItems returns orphaned items created by the manual-commit strategy.
   229→// This includes:
   230→//   - Shadow branches that weren't auto-cleaned during commit condensation
   231→//   - Session state files with no corresponding checkpoints or shadow branches
   232→func (s *ManualCommitStrategy) ListOrphanedItems() ([]CleanupItem, error) {
   233→	var items []CleanupItem
   234→
   235→	// Shadow branches (should have been auto-cleaned after condensation)
   236→	branches, err := ListShadowBranches()
   237→	if err != nil {
   238→		return nil, err
   239→	}
   240→	for _, branch := range branches {
   241→		items = append(items, CleanupItem{
   242→			Type:   CleanupTypeShadowBranch,
   243→			ID:     branch,
   244→			Reason: "shadow branch (should have been auto-cleaned)",
   245→		})
   246→	}
   247→
   248→	// Orphaned session states are detected by ListOrphanedSessionStates
   249→	// which is strategy-agnostic (checks both shadow branches and checkpoints)
   250→
   251→	return items, nil
   252→}
   253→
   254→//nolint:gochecknoinits // Standard pattern for strategy registration
   255→func init() {
   256→	// Register manual-commit as the primary strategy name
   257→	Register(StrategyNameManualCommit, NewManualCommitStrategy)
   258→}
