   129→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) SaveChanges(ctx SaveContext) error {
   130→	repo, err := OpenRepository()
   131→	if err != nil {
   132→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to open git repository: %w", err)
   133→	}
   134→
   135→	// Generate checkpoint ID for this commit
   136→	cpID, err := id.Generate()
   137→	if err != nil {
   138→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to generate checkpoint ID: %w", err)
   139→	}
   140→	// Step 1: Commit code changes to active branch with checkpoint ID trailer
   141→	// We do code first to avoid orphaned metadata if this step fails.
   142→	// If metadata commit fails after this, the code commit exists but GetRewindPoints
   143→	// already handles missing metadata gracefully (skips commits without metadata).
   144→	codeResult, err := s.commitCodeToActive(repo, ctx, cpID)
   145→	if err != nil {
   146→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to commit code to active branch: %w", err)
   147→	}
   148→
   149→	// If no code commit was created (no changes), skip metadata creation
   150→	// This prevents orphaned metadata commits that don't correspond to any code commit
   151→	if !codeResult.Created {
   152→		logCtx := logging.WithComponent(context.Background(), "checkpoint")
   153→		logging.Info(logCtx, "checkpoint skipped (no changes)",
   154→			slog.String("strategy", "auto-commit"),
   155→			slog.String("checkpoint_type", "session"),
   156→		)
   157→		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Skipped checkpoint (no changes since last commit)\n")
   158→		return nil
   159→	}
   160→
   161→	// Step 2: Commit metadata to entire/sessions branch using sharded path
   162→	// Path is <checkpointID[:2]>/<checkpointID[2:]>/ for direct lookup
   163→	_, err = s.commitMetadataToMetadataBranch(repo, ctx, cpID)
   164→	if err != nil {
   165→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to commit metadata to entire/sessions branch: %w", err)
   166→	}
   167→
   168→	// Log checkpoint creation
   169→	logCtx := logging.WithComponent(context.Background(), "checkpoint")
   170→	logging.Info(logCtx, "checkpoint saved",
   171→		slog.String("strategy", "auto-commit"),
   172→		slog.String("checkpoint_type", "session"),
   173→		slog.String("checkpoint_id", cpID.String()),
   174→		slog.Int("modified_files", len(ctx.ModifiedFiles)),
   175→		slog.Int("new_files", len(ctx.NewFiles)),
   176→		slog.Int("deleted_files", len(ctx.DeletedFiles)),
   177→	)
   178→
   179→	return nil
   180→}
   181→
   182→// commitCodeResult contains the result of committing code to the active branch.
   183→type commitCodeResult struct {
   184→	CommitHash plumbing.Hash
   185→	Created    bool // True if a new commit was created, false if skipped (no changes)
   186→}
   187→
   188→// commitCodeToActive commits code changes to the active branch.
   189→// Adds an Entire-Checkpoint trailer for metadata lookup that survives amend/rebase.
   190→// Returns the result containing commit hash and whether a commit was created.
   191→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) commitCodeToActive(repo *git.Repository, ctx SaveContext, checkpointID id.CheckpointID) (commitCodeResult, error) {
   192→	// Check if there are any code changes to commit
   193→	if len(ctx.ModifiedFiles) == 0 && len(ctx.NewFiles) == 0 && len(ctx.DeletedFiles) == 0 {
   194→		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "No code changes to commit to active branch\n")
   195→		// Return current HEAD hash but mark as not created
   196→		head, err := repo.Head()
   197→		if err != nil {
   198→			return commitCodeResult{}, fmt.Errorf("failed to get HEAD: %w", err)
   199→		}
   200→		return commitCodeResult{CommitHash: head.Hash(), Created: false}, nil
   201→	}
   202→
   203→	worktree, err := repo.Worktree()
   204→	if err != nil {
   205→		return commitCodeResult{}, fmt.Errorf("failed to get worktree: %w", err)
   206→	}
   207→
   208→	// Get HEAD hash before commit to detect if commitOrHead actually creates a new commit
   209→	// (commitOrHead returns HEAD hash without error when git.ErrEmptyCommit occurs)
   210→	headBefore, err := repo.Head()
   211→	if err != nil {
   212→		return commitCodeResult{}, fmt.Errorf("failed to get HEAD: %w", err)
   213→	}
   214→
   215→	// Stage code changes
   216→	StageFiles(worktree, ctx.ModifiedFiles, ctx.NewFiles, ctx.DeletedFiles, StageForSession)
   217→
   218→	// Add checkpoint ID trailer to commit message
   219→	commitMsg := ctx.CommitMessage + "\n\n" + trailers.CheckpointTrailerKey + ": " + checkpointID.String()
   220→
   221→	author := &object.Signature{
   222→		Name:  ctx.AuthorName,
   223→		Email: ctx.AuthorEmail,
   224→		When:  time.Now(),
   225→	}
   226→	commitHash, err := commitOrHead(repo, worktree, commitMsg, author)
   227→	if err != nil {
   228→		return commitCodeResult{}, err
   229→	}
   230→
   231→	// Check if a new commit was actually created by comparing with HEAD before
   232→	created := commitHash != headBefore.Hash()
   233→	if created {
   234→		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Committed code changes to active branch (%s)\n", commitHash.String()[:7])
   235→	}
   236→	return commitCodeResult{CommitHash: commitHash, Created: created}, nil
   237→}
   238→
   239→// commitMetadataToMetadataBranch commits session metadata to the entire/sessions branch.
   240→// Metadata is stored at sharded path: <checkpointID[:2]>/<checkpointID[2:]>/
   241→// This allows direct lookup from the checkpoint ID trailer on the code commit.
   242→// Uses checkpoint.WriteCommitted for git operations.
   243→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) commitMetadataToMetadataBranch(repo *git.Repository, ctx SaveContext, checkpointID id.CheckpointID) (plumbing.Hash, error) {
   244→	store, err := s.getCheckpointStore()
   245→	if err != nil {
   246→		return plumbing.ZeroHash, fmt.Errorf("failed to get checkpoint store: %w", err)
   247→	}
   248→
   249→	// Extract session ID from metadata dir
   250→	sessionID := filepath.Base(ctx.MetadataDir)
   251→
   252→	// Get current branch name
   253→	branchName := GetCurrentBranchName(repo)
   254→
   255→	// Combine all file changes into FilesTouched (same as manual-commit)
   256→	filesTouched := mergeFilesTouched(nil, ctx.ModifiedFiles, ctx.NewFiles, ctx.DeletedFiles)
   257→
   258→	// Write committed checkpoint using the checkpoint store
   259→	err = store.WriteCommitted(context.Background(), checkpoint.WriteCommittedOptions{
   260→		CheckpointID:                checkpointID,
   261→		SessionID:                   sessionID,
   262→		Strategy:                    StrategyNameAutoCommit, // Use new strategy name
   263→		Branch:                      branchName,
   264→		MetadataDir:                 ctx.MetadataDirAbs, // Copy all files from metadata dir
   265→		AuthorName:                  ctx.AuthorName,
   266→		AuthorEmail:                 ctx.AuthorEmail,
   267→		Agent:                       ctx.AgentType,
   268→		TranscriptIdentifierAtStart: ctx.StepTranscriptIdentifier,
   269→		CheckpointTranscriptStart:   ctx.StepTranscriptStart,
   270→		TokenUsage:                  ctx.TokenUsage,
   271→		CheckpointsCount:            1,            // Each auto-commit checkpoint = 1
   272→		FilesTouched:                filesTouched, // Track modified files (same as manual-commit)
   273→	})
   274→	if err != nil {
   275→		return plumbing.ZeroHash, fmt.Errorf("failed to write committed checkpoint: %w", err)
   276→	}
   277→
   278→	fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Committed session metadata to %s (%s)\n", paths.MetadataBranchName, checkpointID)
   279→	return plumbing.ZeroHash, nil // Commit hash not needed by callers
   280→}
   281→
   282→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) GetRewindPoints(limit int) ([]RewindPoint, error) {
   283→	// For auto-commit strategy, rewind points are found by looking for Entire-Checkpoint trailers
   284→	// in the current branch's commit history. The checkpoint ID provides direct lookup
   285→	// to metadata on entire/sessions branch.
   286→	repo, err := OpenRepository()
   287→	if err != nil {
   288→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to open git repository: %w", err)
   289→	}
   290→
   291→	head, err := repo.Head()
   292→	if err != nil {
   293→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get HEAD: %w", err)
   294→	}
   295→
   296→	// Get metadata branch tree for lookups
   297→	metadataTree, err := GetMetadataBranchTree(repo)
   298→	if err != nil {
   299→		// No metadata branch yet is fine
   300→		return []RewindPoint{}, nil //nolint:nilerr // Expected when no metadata exists
   301→	}
   302→
   303→	// Get the main branch commit hash to determine branch-only commits
   304→	mainBranchHash := GetMainBranchHash(repo)
   305→
   306→	// Walk current branch history looking for commits with checkpoint trailers
   307→	iter, err := repo.Log(&git.LogOptions{
   308→		From:  head.Hash(),
   309→		Order: git.LogOrderCommitterTime,
   310→	})
   311→	if err != nil {
   312→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get commit log: %w", err)
   313→	}
   314→
   315→	var points []RewindPoint
   316→	count := 0
   317→
   318→	err = iter.ForEach(func(c *object.Commit) error {
   319→		if count >= logsOnlyScanLimit || len(points) >= limit {
   320→			return errStop
   321→		}
   322→		count++
   323→
   324→		// Check for Entire-Checkpoint trailer
   325→		cpID, found := trailers.ParseCheckpoint(c.Message)
   326→		if !found {
   327→			return nil
   328→		}
   329→
   330→		// Look up metadata from sharded path
   331→		checkpointPath := cpID.Path()
   332→		metadata, err := ReadCheckpointMetadata(metadataTree, checkpointPath)
   333→		if err != nil {
   334→			// Checkpoint exists in commit but no metadata found - skip this commit
   335→			return nil //nolint:nilerr // Intentional: skip commits without metadata
   336→		}
   337→
   338→		message := strings.Split(c.Message, "\n")[0]
   339→
   340→		// Determine if this is a full rewind or logs-only
   341→		// Full rewind is allowed if commit is only on this branch (not reachable from main)
   342→		isLogsOnly := false
   343→		if mainBranchHash != plumbing.ZeroHash {
   344→			if IsAncestorOf(repo, c.Hash, mainBranchHash) {
   345→				isLogsOnly = true
   346→			}
   347→		}
   348→
   349→		// Build metadata path - for task checkpoints, include the task path
   350→		metadataDir := checkpointPath
   351→		if metadata.IsTask && metadata.ToolUseID != "" {
   352→			metadataDir = checkpointPath + "/tasks/" + metadata.ToolUseID
   353→		}
   354→
   355→		// Read session prompt from metadata tree
   356→		sessionPrompt := ReadSessionPromptFromTree(metadataTree, checkpointPath)
   357→
   358→		points = append(points, RewindPoint{
   359→			ID:               c.Hash.String(),
   360→			Message:          message,
   361→			MetadataDir:      metadataDir,
   362→			Date:             c.Author.When,
   363→			IsLogsOnly:       isLogsOnly,
   364→			CheckpointID:     cpID,
   365→			IsTaskCheckpoint: metadata.IsTask,
   366→			ToolUseID:        metadata.ToolUseID,
   367→			Agent:            metadata.Agent,
   368→			SessionID:        metadata.SessionID,
   369→			SessionPrompt:    sessionPrompt,
   370→		})
   371→
   372→		return nil
   373→	})
   374→
   375→	if err != nil && !errors.Is(err, errStop) {
   376→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to iterate commits: %w", err)
   377→	}
   378→
   379→	return points, nil
   380→}
   381→
   382→// findTaskMetadataPathForCommit looks up the task metadata path for a task checkpoint commit
   383→// by searching the entire/sessions branch commit history for the checkpoint directory.
   384→// Returns ("", nil) if metadata is not found - this is expected for commits without metadata.
   385→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) findTaskMetadataPathForCommit(repo *git.Repository, commitSHA, toolUseID string) (string, error) {
   386→	// Get the entire/sessions branch
   387→	refName := plumbing.NewBranchReferenceName(paths.MetadataBranchName)
   388→	ref, err := repo.Reference(refName, true)
   389→	if err != nil {
   390→		if isNotFoundError(err) {
   391→			return "", nil // No metadata branch yet
   392→		}
   393→		return "", fmt.Errorf("failed to get metadata branch: %w", err)
   394→	}
   395→
   396→	// Search commit history for a commit referencing this code commit SHA and tool use ID
   397→	shortSHA := commitSHA
   398→	if len(shortSHA) > 7 {
   399→		shortSHA = shortSHA[:7]
   400→	}
   401→
   402→	iter, err := repo.Log(&git.LogOptions{From: ref.Hash()})
   403→	if err != nil {
   404→		return "", fmt.Errorf("failed to get commit log: %w", err)
   405→	}
   406→
   407→	var foundTaskPath string
   408→	err = iter.ForEach(func(commit *object.Commit) error {
   409→		// Check if commit message contains "Commit: <sha>" and the tool use ID
   410→		if strings.Contains(commit.Message, "Commit: "+shortSHA) &&
   411→			strings.Contains(commit.Message, toolUseID) {
   412→			// Parse task metadata trailer
   413→			if taskPath, found := trailers.ParseTaskMetadata(commit.Message); found {
   414→				foundTaskPath = taskPath
   415→				return errStop // Found it
   416→			}
   417→		}
   418→		return nil
   419→	})
   420→	if err != nil && !errors.Is(err, errStop) {
   421→		return "", fmt.Errorf("failed to iterate commits: %w", err)
   422→	}
   423→
   424→	return foundTaskPath, nil
   425→}
   426→
   427→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) Rewind(point RewindPoint) error {
   428→	commitHash := plumbing.NewHash(point.ID)
   429→	shortID, err := HardResetWithProtection(commitHash)
   430→	if err != nil {
   431→		return err
   432→	}
   433→
   434→	fmt.Println()
   435→	fmt.Printf("Reset to commit %s\n", shortID)
   436→	fmt.Println()
   437→
   438→	return nil
   439→}
   440→
   441→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) CanRewind() (bool, string, error) {
   442→	return checkCanRewind()
   443→}
   444→
   445→// PreviewRewind returns what will happen if rewinding to the given point.
   446→// For auto-commit strategy, this returns nil since git reset doesn't delete untracked files.
   447→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) PreviewRewind(_ RewindPoint) (*RewindPreview, error) {
   448→	// Auto-commit uses git reset --hard which doesn't affect untracked files
   449→	// Return empty preview to indicate no untracked files will be deleted
   450→	return &RewindPreview{}, nil
   451→}
   452→
   453→// EnsureSetup ensures the strategy's required setup is in place.
   454→// For auto-commit strategy:
   455→// - Ensure .entire/.gitignore has all required entries
   456→// - Create orphan entire/sessions branch if it doesn't exist
   457→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) EnsureSetup() error {
   458→	if err := EnsureEntireGitignore(); err != nil {
   459→		return err
   460→	}
   461→
   462→	repo, err := OpenRepository()
   463→	if err != nil {
   464→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to open git repository: %w", err)
   465→	}
   466→
   467→	// Ensure the entire/sessions orphan branch exists
   468→	if err := EnsureMetadataBranch(repo); err != nil {
   469→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to ensure metadata branch: %w", err)
   470→	}
   471→
   472→	return nil
   473→}
   474→
   475→// GetSessionInfo returns session information for linking commits.
   476→// For auto-commit strategy, we don't track active sessions - metadata is stored on
   477→// entire/sessions branch when SaveChanges is called. Active branch commits
   478→// are kept clean (no trailers), so this returns ErrNoSession.
   479→// Use ListSessions() or GetSession() to retrieve session info from the metadata branch.
   480→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) GetSessionInfo() (*SessionInfo, error) {
   481→	// Dual strategy doesn't track active sessions like shadow does.
   482→	// Session metadata is stored on entire/sessions branch and can be
   483→	// retrieved via ListSessions() or GetSession().
   484→	return nil, ErrNoSession
   485→}
   486→
   487→// SaveTaskCheckpoint creates a checkpoint commit for a completed task.
   488→// For auto-commit strategy:
   489→// 1. Commit code changes to active branch (no trailers - clean history)
   490→// 2. Commit task metadata to entire/sessions branch with checkpoint format
   491→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) SaveTaskCheckpoint(ctx TaskCheckpointContext) error {
   492→	repo, err := OpenRepository()
   493→	if err != nil {
   494→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to open git repository: %w", err)
   495→	}
   496→
   497→	// Ensure entire/sessions branch exists
   498→	if err := EnsureMetadataBranch(repo); err != nil {
   499→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to ensure metadata branch: %w", err)
   500→	}
   501→
   502→	// Generate checkpoint ID for this task checkpoint
   503→	cpID, err := id.Generate()
   504→	if err != nil {
   505→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to generate checkpoint ID: %w", err)
   506→	}
   507→
   508→	// Step 1: Commit code changes to active branch with checkpoint ID trailer
   509→	// We do code first to avoid orphaned metadata if this step fails.
   510→	_, err = s.commitTaskCodeToActive(repo, ctx, cpID)
   511→	if err != nil {
   512→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to commit task code to active branch: %w", err)
   513→	}
   514→
   515→	// Step 2: Commit task metadata to entire/sessions branch at sharded path
   516→	_, err = s.commitTaskMetadataToMetadataBranch(repo, ctx, cpID)
   517→	if err != nil {
   518→		return fmt.Errorf("failed to commit task metadata to entire/sessions branch: %w", err)
   519→	}
   520→
   521→	// Log task checkpoint creation
   522→	logCtx := logging.WithComponent(context.Background(), "checkpoint")
   523→	attrs := []any{
   524→		slog.String("strategy", "auto-commit"),
   525→		slog.String("checkpoint_type", "task"),
   526→		slog.String("checkpoint_id", cpID.String()),
   527→		slog.String("checkpoint_uuid", ctx.CheckpointUUID),
   528→		slog.String("tool_use_id", ctx.ToolUseID),
   529→		slog.String("subagent_type", ctx.SubagentType),
   530→		slog.Int("modified_files", len(ctx.ModifiedFiles)),
   531→		slog.Int("new_files", len(ctx.NewFiles)),
   532→		slog.Int("deleted_files", len(ctx.DeletedFiles)),
   533→	}
   534→	if ctx.IsIncremental {
   535→		attrs = append(attrs,
   536→			slog.Bool("is_incremental", true),
   537→			slog.String("incremental_type", ctx.IncrementalType),
   538→			slog.Int("incremental_sequence", ctx.IncrementalSequence),
   539→		)
   540→	}
   541→	logging.Info(logCtx, "task checkpoint saved", attrs...)
   542→
   543→	return nil
   544→}
   545→
   546→// commitTaskCodeToActive commits task code changes to the active branch.
   547→// Adds an Entire-Checkpoint trailer for metadata lookup that survives amend/rebase.
   548→// Skips commit creation if there are no file changes.
   549→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) commitTaskCodeToActive(repo *git.Repository, ctx TaskCheckpointContext, checkpointID id.CheckpointID) (plumbing.Hash, error) {
   550→	hasFileChanges := len(ctx.ModifiedFiles) > 0 || len(ctx.NewFiles) > 0 || len(ctx.DeletedFiles) > 0
   551→
   552→	// If no file changes, skip code commit
   553→	if !hasFileChanges {
   554→		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "No code changes to commit for task checkpoint\n")
   555→		// Return current HEAD hash so metadata can still be stored
   556→		head, err := repo.Head()
   557→		if err != nil {
   558→			return plumbing.ZeroHash, fmt.Errorf("failed to get HEAD: %w", err)
   559→		}
   560→		return head.Hash(), nil
   561→	}
   562→
   563→	worktree, err := repo.Worktree()
   564→	if err != nil {
   565→		return plumbing.ZeroHash, fmt.Errorf("failed to get worktree: %w", err)
   566→	}
   567→
   568→	// Stage code changes
   569→	StageFiles(worktree, ctx.ModifiedFiles, ctx.NewFiles, ctx.DeletedFiles, StageForTask)
   570→
   571→	// Build commit message with checkpoint trailer
   572→	shortToolUseID := ctx.ToolUseID
   573→	if len(shortToolUseID) > 12 {
   574→		shortToolUseID = shortToolUseID[:12]
   575→	}
   576→
   577→	var subject string
   578→	if ctx.IsIncremental {
   579→		subject = FormatIncrementalSubject(
   580→			ctx.IncrementalType,
   581→			ctx.SubagentType,
   582→			ctx.TaskDescription,
   583→			ctx.TodoContent,
   584→			ctx.IncrementalSequence,
   585→			shortToolUseID,
   586→		)
   587→	} else {
   588→		subject = FormatSubagentEndMessage(ctx.SubagentType, ctx.TaskDescription, shortToolUseID)
   589→	}
   590→
   591→	// Add checkpoint ID trailer to commit message
   592→	commitMsg := subject + "\n\n" + trailers.CheckpointTrailerKey + ": " + checkpointID.String()
   593→
   594→	author := &object.Signature{
   595→		Name:  ctx.AuthorName,
   596→		Email: ctx.AuthorEmail,
   597→		When:  time.Now(),
   598→	}
   599→
   600→	commitHash, err := commitOrHead(repo, worktree, commitMsg, author)
   601→	if err != nil {
   602→		return plumbing.ZeroHash, err
   603→	}
   604→
   605→	if ctx.IsIncremental {
   606→		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Committed incremental checkpoint #%d to active branch (%s)\n", ctx.IncrementalSequence, commitHash.String()[:7])
   607→	} else {
   608→		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Committed task checkpoint to active branch (%s)\n", commitHash.String()[:7])
   609→	}
   610→	return commitHash, nil
   611→}
   612→
   613→// commitTaskMetadataToMetadataBranch commits task metadata to the entire/sessions branch.
   614→// Uses sharded path: <checkpointID[:2]>/<checkpointID[2:]>/tasks/<tool-use-id>/
   615→// Returns the metadata commit hash.
   616→// When IsIncremental is true, only writes the incremental checkpoint file, skipping transcripts.
   617→// Uses checkpoint.WriteCommitted for git operations.
   618→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) commitTaskMetadataToMetadataBranch(repo *git.Repository, ctx TaskCheckpointContext, checkpointID id.CheckpointID) (plumbing.Hash, error) {
   619→	store, err := s.getCheckpointStore()
   620→	if err != nil {
   621→		return plumbing.ZeroHash, fmt.Errorf("failed to get checkpoint store: %w", err)
   622→	}
   623→
   624→	// Format commit subject line for better git log readability
   625→	shortToolUseID := ctx.ToolUseID
   626→	if len(shortToolUseID) > 12 {
   627→		shortToolUseID = shortToolUseID[:12]
   628→	}
   629→
   630→	var messageSubject string
   631→	if ctx.IsIncremental {
   632→		messageSubject = FormatIncrementalSubject(
   633→			ctx.IncrementalType,
   634→			ctx.SubagentType,
   635→			ctx.TaskDescription,
   636→			ctx.TodoContent,
   637→			ctx.IncrementalSequence,
   638→			shortToolUseID,
   639→		)
   640→	} else {
   641→		messageSubject = FormatSubagentEndMessage(ctx.SubagentType, ctx.TaskDescription, shortToolUseID)
   642→	}
   643→
   644→	// Get current branch name
   645→	branchName := GetCurrentBranchName(repo)
   646→
   647→	// Write committed checkpoint using the checkpoint store
   648→	err = store.WriteCommitted(context.Background(), checkpoint.WriteCommittedOptions{
   649→		CheckpointID:           checkpointID,
   650→		SessionID:              ctx.SessionID,
   651→		Strategy:               StrategyNameAutoCommit,
   652→		Branch:                 branchName,
   653→		IsTask:                 true,
   654→		ToolUseID:              ctx.ToolUseID,
   655→		AgentID:                ctx.AgentID,
   656→		CheckpointUUID:         ctx.CheckpointUUID,
   657→		TranscriptPath:         ctx.TranscriptPath,
   658→		SubagentTranscriptPath: ctx.SubagentTranscriptPath,
   659→		IsIncremental:          ctx.IsIncremental,
   660→		IncrementalSequence:    ctx.IncrementalSequence,
   661→		IncrementalType:        ctx.IncrementalType,
   662→		IncrementalData:        ctx.IncrementalData,
   663→		CommitSubject:          messageSubject,
   664→		AuthorName:             ctx.AuthorName,
   665→		AuthorEmail:            ctx.AuthorEmail,
   666→		Agent:                  ctx.AgentType,
   667→	})
   668→	if err != nil {
   669→		return plumbing.ZeroHash, fmt.Errorf("failed to write task checkpoint: %w", err)
   670→	}
   671→
   672→	if ctx.IsIncremental {
   673→		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Committed incremental checkpoint metadata to %s (%s)\n", paths.MetadataBranchName, checkpointID)
   674→	} else {
   675→		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Committed task metadata to %s (%s)\n", paths.MetadataBranchName, checkpointID)
   676→	}
   677→	return plumbing.ZeroHash, nil // Commit hash not needed by callers
   678→}
   679→
   680→// GetTaskCheckpoint returns the task checkpoint for a given rewind point.
   681→// For auto-commit strategy, checkpoints are stored on the entire/sessions branch in checkpoint directories.
   682→// Returns ErrNotTaskCheckpoint if the point is not a task checkpoint.
   683→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) GetTaskCheckpoint(point RewindPoint) (*TaskCheckpoint, error) {
   684→	if !point.IsTaskCheckpoint {
   685→		return nil, ErrNotTaskCheckpoint
   686→	}
   687→
   688→	repo, err := OpenRepository()
   689→	if err != nil {
   690→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to open repository: %w", err)
   691→	}
   692→
   693→	// Get the entire/sessions branch
   694→	refName := plumbing.NewBranchReferenceName(paths.MetadataBranchName)
   695→	ref, err := repo.Reference(refName, true)
   696→	if err != nil {
   697→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("metadata branch %s not found: %w", paths.MetadataBranchName, err)
   698→	}
   699→
   700→	metadataCommit, err := repo.CommitObject(ref.Hash())
   701→	if err != nil {
   702→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get metadata branch commit: %w", err)
   703→	}
   704→
   705→	tree, err := metadataCommit.Tree()
   706→	if err != nil {
   707→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get metadata tree: %w", err)
   708→	}
   709→
   710→	// Find checkpoint using the metadata path from rewind point
   711→	// MetadataDir for auto-commit task checkpoints is: cond-YYYYMMDD-HHMMSS-XXXXXXXX/tasks/<tool-use-id>
   712→	checkpointPath := point.MetadataDir + "/checkpoint.json"
   713→	file, err := tree.File(checkpointPath)
   714→	if err != nil {
   715→		// Try finding via commit SHA lookup
   716→		taskCheckpointPath, findErr := s.findTaskCheckpointPath(repo, point.ID, point.ToolUseID)
   717→		if findErr != nil {
   718→			return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to find checkpoint at %s: %w", checkpointPath, err)
   719→		}
   720→		file, err = tree.File(taskCheckpointPath)
   721→		if err != nil {
   722→			return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to find checkpoint at %s: %w", taskCheckpointPath, err)
   723→		}
   724→	}
   725→
   726→	content, err := file.Contents()
   727→	if err != nil {
   728→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to read checkpoint: %w", err)
   729→	}
   730→
   731→	var checkpoint TaskCheckpoint
   732→	if err := json.Unmarshal([]byte(content), &checkpoint); err != nil {
   733→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to parse checkpoint: %w", err)
   734→	}
   735→
   736→	return &checkpoint, nil
   737→}
   738→
   739→// GetTaskCheckpointTranscript returns the session transcript for a task checkpoint.
   740→// For auto-commit strategy, transcripts are stored on the entire/sessions branch in checkpoint directories.
   741→// Returns ErrNotTaskCheckpoint if the point is not a task checkpoint.
   742→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) GetTaskCheckpointTranscript(point RewindPoint) ([]byte, error) {
   743→	if !point.IsTaskCheckpoint {
   744→		return nil, ErrNotTaskCheckpoint
   745→	}
   746→
   747→	repo, err := OpenRepository()
   748→	if err != nil {
   749→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to open repository: %w", err)
   750→	}
   751→
   752→	// Get the entire/sessions branch
   753→	refName := plumbing.NewBranchReferenceName(paths.MetadataBranchName)
   754→	ref, err := repo.Reference(refName, true)
   755→	if err != nil {
   756→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("metadata branch %s not found: %w", paths.MetadataBranchName, err)
   757→	}
   758→
   759→	metadataCommit, err := repo.CommitObject(ref.Hash())
   760→	if err != nil {
   761→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get metadata branch commit: %w", err)
   762→	}
   763→
   764→	tree, err := metadataCommit.Tree()
   765→	if err != nil {
   766→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get metadata tree: %w", err)
   767→	}
   768→
   769→	// MetadataDir for auto-commit task checkpoints is: <id[:2]>/<id[2:]>/tasks/<tool-use-id>
   770→	// Extract the checkpoint path by removing "/tasks/<tool-use-id>"
   771→	metadataDir := point.MetadataDir
   772→	if idx := strings.Index(metadataDir, "/tasks/"); idx > 0 {
   773→		checkpointPath := metadataDir[:idx]
   774→
   775→		// Use the first session's transcript path from sessions array
   776→		transcriptPath := ""
   777→		summaryFile, summaryErr := tree.File(checkpointPath + "/" + paths.MetadataFileName)
   778→		if summaryErr == nil {
   779→			summaryContent, contentErr := summaryFile.Contents()
   780→			if contentErr == nil {
   781→				var summary checkpoint.CheckpointSummary
   782→				if json.Unmarshal([]byte(summaryContent), &summary) == nil && len(summary.Sessions) > 0 {
   783→					// Use first session's transcript path (task checkpoints have only one session)
   784→					// SessionFilePaths now contains absolute paths with leading "/"
   785→					// Strip the leading "/" for tree.File() which expects paths without leading slash
   786→					if summary.Sessions[0].Transcript != "" {
   787→						transcriptPath = strings.TrimPrefix(summary.Sessions[0].Transcript, "/")
   788→					}
   789→				}
   790→			}
   791→		}
   792→
   793→		// Fall back to old format if sessions map not available
   794→		if transcriptPath == "" {
   795→			transcriptPath = checkpointPath + "/" + paths.TranscriptFileName
   796→		}
   797→
   798→		file, err := tree.File(transcriptPath)
   799→		if err != nil {
   800→			return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to find transcript at %s: %w", transcriptPath, err)
   801→		}
   802→		content, err := file.Contents()
   803→		if err != nil {
   804→			return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to read transcript: %w", err)
   805→		}
   806→		return []byte(content), nil
   807→	}
   808→
   809→	return nil, fmt.Errorf("invalid metadata path format: %s", metadataDir)
   810→}

   812→// findTaskCheckpointPath finds the full path to a task checkpoint on the entire/sessions branch.
   813→// Searches checkpoint directories for the task checkpoint matching the commit SHA and tool use ID.
   814→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) findTaskCheckpointPath(repo *git.Repository, commitSHA, toolUseID string) (string, error) {
   815→	// Use findTaskMetadataPathForCommit which searches commit history
   816→	taskPath, err := s.findTaskMetadataPathForCommit(repo, commitSHA, toolUseID)
   817→	if err != nil {
   818→		return "", err
   819→	}
   820→	if taskPath == "" {
   821→		return "", errors.New("task checkpoint not found")
   822→	}
   823→	// taskPath is like: cond-YYYYMMDD-HHMMSS-XXXXXXXX/tasks/<tool-use-id>/checkpoints/001-<tool-use-id>.json
   824→	// We need: cond-YYYYMMDD-HHMMSS-XXXXXXXX/tasks/<tool-use-id>/checkpoint.json
   825→	if idx := strings.Index(taskPath, "/checkpoints/"); idx > 0 {
   826→		return taskPath[:idx] + "/checkpoint.json", nil
   827→	}
   828→	return taskPath + "/checkpoint.json", nil
   829→}

   831→// GetMetadataRef returns a reference to the metadata for the given checkpoint.
   832→// For auto-commit strategy, returns the checkpoint path on entire/sessions branch.
   833→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) GetMetadataRef(checkpoint Checkpoint) string {
   834→	if checkpoint.CheckpointID.IsEmpty() {
   835→		return ""
   836→	}
   837→	return paths.MetadataBranchName + ":" + checkpoint.CheckpointID.Path()
   838→}
   839→
   840→// GetSessionMetadataRef returns a reference to the most recent metadata for a session.
   841→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) GetSessionMetadataRef(sessionID string) string {
   842→	session, err := GetSession(sessionID)
   843→	if err != nil || len(session.Checkpoints) == 0 {
   844→		return ""
   845→	}
   846→	// Checkpoints are ordered with most recent first
   847→	return s.GetMetadataRef(session.Checkpoints[0])
   848→}
   849→
   850→// GetSessionContext returns the context.md content for a session.
   851→// For auto-commit strategy, reads from the entire/sessions branch using the checkpoint store.
   852→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) GetSessionContext(sessionID string) string {
   853→	session, err := GetSession(sessionID)
   854→	if err != nil || len(session.Checkpoints) == 0 {
   855→		return ""
   856→	}
   857→
   858→	// Get the most recent checkpoint
   859→	cp := session.Checkpoints[0]
   860→	if cp.CheckpointID.IsEmpty() {
   861→		return ""
   862→	}
   863→
   864→	store, err := s.getCheckpointStore()
   865→	if err != nil {
   866→		return ""
   867→	}
   868→
   869→	content, err := store.ReadSessionContentByID(context.Background(), cp.CheckpointID, sessionID)
   870→	if err != nil || content == nil {
   871→		return ""
   872→	}
   873→
   874→	return content.Context
   875→}
   876→
   877→// GetCheckpointLog returns the session transcript for a specific checkpoint.
   878→// For auto-commit strategy, looks up checkpoint by ID on the entire/sessions branch using the checkpoint store.
   879→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) GetCheckpointLog(cp Checkpoint) ([]byte, error) {
   880→	if cp.CheckpointID.IsEmpty() {

   883→
   884→	store, err := s.getCheckpointStore()
   885→	if err != nil {
   886→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get checkpoint store: %w", err)
   887→	}
   888→
   889→	content, err := store.ReadLatestSessionContent(context.Background(), cp.CheckpointID)
   890→	if err != nil {
   891→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to read checkpoint: %w", err)
   892→	}
   893→	if content == nil {
   894→		return nil, ErrNoMetadata
   895→	}
   896→
   897→	return content.Transcript, nil
   898→}

   978→// ListOrphanedItems returns orphaned items created by the auto-commit strategy.
   979→// For auto-commit, checkpoints are orphaned when no commit has an Entire-Checkpoint
   980→// trailer referencing them (e.g., after rebasing or squashing).
   981→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) ListOrphanedItems() ([]CleanupItem, error) {
   982→	repo, err := OpenRepository()
   983→	if err != nil {
   984→		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to open repository: %w", err)

  1007→		if readErr != nil || summary == nil {
  1008→			continue
  1009→		}
  1010→		// Only consider checkpoints created by this strategy
  1011→		if summary.Strategy == StrategyNameAutoCommit {
  1012→			autoCommitCheckpoints[cp.CheckpointID.String()] = true
  1013→		}
  1014→	}
  1015→
  1016→	if len(autoCommitCheckpoints) == 0 {
  1017→		return []CleanupItem{}, nil
  1018→	}
  1019→
  1020→	// Find checkpoint IDs referenced in commits
  1021→	referencedCheckpoints := s.findReferencedCheckpoints(repo)
  1022→
  1023→	// Find orphaned checkpoints
  1024→	var items []CleanupItem
  1025→	for checkpointID := range autoCommitCheckpoints {
  1026→		if !referencedCheckpoints[checkpointID] {

  1029→				ID:     checkpointID,
  1030→				Reason: "no commit references this checkpoint",
  1031→			})
  1032→		}

  1038→// findReferencedCheckpoints scans commits for Entire-Checkpoint trailers.
  1039→func (s *AutoCommitStrategy) findReferencedCheckpoints(repo *git.Repository) map[string]bool {
  1040→	referenced := make(map[string]bool)
  1041→
  1042→	refs, err := repo.References()
  1043→	if err != nil {
  1044→		return referenced
  1045→	}
  1046→
  1047→	visited := make(map[plumbing.Hash]bool)
  1048→
  1049→	_ = refs.ForEach(func(ref *plumbing.Reference) error { //nolint:errcheck // Best effort
  1050→		if !ref.Name().IsBranch() {
  1051→			return nil
  1052→		}
  1053→		// Skip entire/* branches
  1054→		branchName := strings.TrimPrefix(ref.Name().String(), "refs/heads/")
  1055→		if strings.HasPrefix(branchName, "entire/") {
  1056→			return nil
  1057→		}
  1058→
  1059→		iter, iterErr := repo.Log(&git.LogOptions{From: ref.Hash()})
  1060→		if iterErr != nil {
  1061→			return nil //nolint:nilerr // Best effort
  1062→		}
  1063→
  1064→		count := 0
  1065→		_ = iter.ForEach(func(c *object.Commit) error { //nolint:errcheck // Best effort
  1066→			count++
  1067→			if count > 1000 {
  1068→				return errors.New("limit reached")
  1069→			}
  1070→			if visited[c.Hash] {
  1071→				return nil
  1072→			}
  1073→			visited[c.Hash] = true
  1074→
  1075→			if cpID, found := trailers.ParseCheckpoint(c.Message); found {
  1076→				referenced[cpID.String()] = true
  1077→			}
  1078→			return nil
  1079→		})
  1080→		return nil
  1081→	})
  1082→
  1083→	return referenced
  1084→}

  1087→func init() {
  1088→	// Register auto-commit as the primary strategy name
  1089→	Register(StrategyNameAutoCommit, NewAutoCommitStrategy)
  1090→}

message.content:
This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The summary below covers the earlier portion of the conversation.

Analysis:
Let me chronologically analyze the conversation:

1. The user invoked `/github-pr-review` skill for PR #169 on the `alex/ent-221-type-consolidation` branch.

2. I fetched PR details - PR #169 "Consolidate session state types and simplify transcript tracking (ENT-221)" by khaong, and found review comments.

3. I analyzed all comment threads and found 10 threads total, but only 1 needed a response - from cursor[bot] about missing backward compat migration for `LastInteractionTime` field rename (comment ID 2778466000).

4. The cursor[bot] comment identified that `LastInteractionAt` was renamed to `LastInteractionTime` with JSON tag changed from `last_interaction_at` to `last_interaction_time` without backward compatibility handling.

// sessionStateToStrategy converts session.State to strategy.SessionState.
func sessionStateToStrategy(state *session.State) *SessionState {
	if state == nil {
		return nil
	}
	result := &SessionState{
		SessionID:                   state.SessionID,
		BaseCommit:                  state.BaseCommit,
		WorktreePath:                state.WorktreePath,
		WorktreeID:                  state.WorktreeID,
		StartedAt:                   state.StartedAt,
		EndedAt:                     state.EndedAt,
		LastInteractionTime:         state.LastInteractionTime,
		CheckpointCount:             state.CheckpointCount,
		CondensedTranscriptLines:    state.CondensedTranscriptLines,
		UntrackedFilesAtStart:       state.UntrackedFilesAtStart,
		FilesTouched:                state.FilesTouched,
		LastCheckpointID:            state.LastCheckpointID,
		AgentType:                   state.AgentType,
		TokenUsage:                  state.TokenUsage,
		TranscriptLinesAtStart:      state.TranscriptLinesAtStart,
		TranscriptIdentifierAtStart: state.TranscriptIdentifierAtStart,
		TranscriptPath:              state.TranscriptPath,
		FirstPrompt:                 state.FirstPrompt,
	}
	// Convert PromptAttributions
	for _, pa := range state.PromptAttributions {
		result.PromptAttributions = append(result.PromptAttributions, PromptAttribution{
			CheckpointNumber:  pa.CheckpointNumber,
			UserLinesAdded:    pa.UserLinesAdded,
			UserLinesRemoved:  pa.UserLinesRemoved,
			AgentLinesAdded:   pa.AgentLinesAdded,
			AgentLinesRemoved: pa.AgentLinesRemoved,
			UserAddedPerFile:  pa.UserAddedPerFile,
		})
	}
	// Convert PendingPromptAttribution
	if state.PendingPromptAttribution != nil {
		result.PendingPromptAttribution = &PromptAttribution{
			CheckpointNumber:  state.PendingPromptAttribution.CheckpointNumber,
			UserLinesAdded:    state.PendingPromptAttribution.UserLinesAdded,
			UserLinesRemoved:  state.PendingPromptAttribution.UserLinesRemoved,
			AgentLinesAdded:   state.PendingPromptAttribution.AgentLinesAdded,
			AgentLinesRemoved: state.PendingPromptAttribution.AgentLinesRemoved,
			UserAddedPerFile:  state.PendingPromptAttribution.UserAddedPerFile,
		}
	}
	return result
}

// sessionStateFromStrategy converts strategy.SessionState to session.State.
func sessionStateFromStrategy(state *SessionState) *session.State {
	if state == nil {
		return nil
	}
	result := &session.State{
		SessionID:                   state.SessionID,
		BaseCommit:                  state.BaseCommit,
		WorktreePath:                state.WorktreePath,
		WorktreeID:                  state.WorktreeID,
		StartedAt:                   state.StartedAt,
		EndedAt:                     state.EndedAt,
		LastInteractionTime:         state.LastInteractionTime,
		CheckpointCount:             state.CheckpointCount,
		CondensedTranscriptLines:    state.CondensedTranscriptLines,
		UntrackedFilesAtStart:       state.UntrackedFilesAtStart,
		FilesTouched:                state.FilesTouched,
		LastCheckpointID:            state.LastCheckpointID,
		AgentType:                   state.AgentType,
		TokenUsage:                  state.TokenUsage,
		TranscriptLinesAtStart:      state.TranscriptLinesAtStart,
		TranscriptIdentifierAtStart: state.TranscriptIdentifierAtStart,
		TranscriptPath:              state.TranscriptPath,
		FirstPrompt:                 state.FirstPrompt,
	}
	// Convert PromptAttributions
	for _, pa := range state.PromptAttributions {
		result.PromptAttributions = append(result.PromptAttributions, session.PromptAttribution{
			CheckpointNumber:  pa.CheckpointNumber,
			UserLinesAdded:    pa.UserLinesAdded,
			UserLinesRemoved:  pa.UserLinesRemoved,
			AgentLinesAdded:   pa.AgentLinesAdded,
			AgentLinesRemoved: pa.AgentLinesRemoved,
			UserAddedPerFile:  pa.UserAddedPerFile,
		})
	}
	// Convert PendingPromptAttribution
	if state.PendingPromptAttribution != nil {
		result.PendingPromptAttribution = &session.PromptAttribution{
			CheckpointNumber:  state.PendingPromptAttribution.CheckpointNumber,
			UserLinesAdded:    state.PendingPromptAttribution.UserLinesAdded,

// sessionStateToStrategy converts session.State to strategy.SessionState.
func sessionStateToStrategy(state *session.State) *SessionState {
	if state == nil {
		return nil
	}
	result := &SessionState{
		SessionID:                   state.SessionID,
		BaseCommit:                  state.BaseCommit,
		WorktreePath:                state.WorktreePath,
		WorktreeID:                  state.WorktreeID,
		StartedAt:                   state.StartedAt,
		EndedAt:                     state.EndedAt,
		LastInteractionTime:         state.LastInteractionTime,
		CheckpointCount:             state.CheckpointCount,
		CondensedTranscriptLines:    state.CondensedTranscriptLines,
		UntrackedFilesAtStart:       state.UntrackedFilesAtStart,
		FilesTouched:                state.FilesTouched,
		LastCheckpointID:            state.LastCheckpointID,
		AgentType:                   state.AgentType,
		TokenUsage:                  state.TokenUsage,
		TranscriptLinesAtStart:      state.TranscriptLinesAtStart,
		TranscriptIdentifierAtStart: state.TranscriptIdentifierAtStart,
		TranscriptPath:              state.TranscriptPath,
		FirstPrompt:                 state.FirstPrompt,
	}
	// Convert PromptAttributions
	for _, pa := range state.PromptAttributions {
		result.PromptAttributions = append(result.PromptAttributions, PromptAttribution{
			CheckpointNumber:  pa.CheckpointNumber,
			UserLinesAdded:    pa.UserLinesAdded,
			UserLinesRemoved:  pa.UserLinesRemoved,
			AgentLinesAdded:   pa.AgentLinesAdded,
			AgentLinesRemoved: pa.AgentLinesRemoved,
			UserAddedPerFile:  pa.UserAddedPerFile,
		})
	}
	// Convert PendingPromptAttribution
	if state.PendingPromptAttribution != nil {
		result.PendingPromptAttribution = &PromptAttribution{
			CheckpointNumber:  state.PendingPromptAttribution.CheckpointNumber,
			UserLinesAdded:    state.PendingPromptAttribution.UserLinesAdded,
			UserLinesRemoved:  state.PendingPromptAttribution.UserLinesRemoved,
			AgentLinesAdded:   state.PendingPromptAttribution.AgentLinesAdded,
			AgentLinesRemoved: state.PendingPromptAttribution.AgentLinesRemoved,
			UserAddedPerFile:  state.PendingPromptAttribution.UserAddedPerFile,
		}
	}
	return result
}

// sessionStateFromStrategy converts strategy.SessionState to session.State.
func sessionStateFromStrategy(state *SessionState) *session.State {
	if state == nil {
		return nil
	}
	result := &session.State{
		SessionID:                   state.SessionID,
		BaseCommit:                  state.BaseCommit,
		WorktreePath:                state.WorktreePath,
		WorktreeID:                  state.WorktreeID,
		StartedAt:                   state.StartedAt,
		EndedAt:                     state.EndedAt,
		LastInteractionTime:         state.LastInteractionTime,
		CheckpointCount:             state.CheckpointCount,
		CondensedTranscriptLines:    state.CondensedTranscriptLines,
		UntrackedFilesAtStart:       state.UntrackedFilesAtStart,
		FilesTouched:                state.FilesTouched,
		LastCheckpointID:            state.LastCheckpointID,
		AgentType:                   state.AgentType,
		TokenUsage:                  state.TokenUsage,
		TranscriptLinesAtStart:      state.TranscriptLinesAtStart,
		TranscriptIdentifierAtStart: state.TranscriptIdentifierAtStart,
		TranscriptPath:              state.TranscriptPath,
		FirstPrompt:                 state.FirstPrompt,
	}
	// Convert PromptAttributions
	for _, pa := range state.PromptAttributions {
		result.PromptAttributions = append(result.PromptAttributions, session.PromptAttribution{
			CheckpointNumber:  pa.CheckpointNumber,
			UserLinesAdded:    pa.UserLinesAdded,
			UserLinesRemoved:  pa.UserLinesRemoved,
			AgentLinesAdded:   pa.AgentLinesAdded,
			AgentLinesRemoved: pa.AgentLinesRemoved,
			UserAddedPerFile:  pa.UserAddedPerFile,
		})
	}
	// Convert PendingPromptAttribution
	if state.PendingPromptAttribution != nil {
		result.PendingPromptAttribution = &session.PromptAttribution{
			CheckpointNumber:  state.PendingPromptAttribution.CheckpointNumber,
			UserLinesAdded:    state.PendingPromptAttribution.UserLinesAdded,
			UserLinesRemoved:  state.PendingPromptAttribution.UserLinesRemoved,
			AgentLinesAdded:   state.PendingPromptAttribution.AgentLinesAdded,
			AgentLinesRemoved: state.PendingPromptAttribution.AgentLinesRemoved,
			UserAddedPerFile:  state.PendingPromptAttribution.UserAddedPerFile,
		}
	}
	return result
}

1→package strategy
     2→
     3→import (
     4→	"fmt"
     5→	"sync"
     6→
     7→	"github.com/entireio/cli/cmd/entire/cli/checkpoint"
     8→	"github.com/entireio/cli/cmd/entire/cli/session"
     9→)
    10→
    11→// ManualCommitStrategy implements the manual-commit strategy for session management.
    12→// It stores checkpoints on shadow branches and condenses session logs to a
    13→// permanent sessions branch when the user commits.
    14→type ManualCommitStrategy struct {
    15→	// stateStore manages session state files in .git/entire-sessions/
    16→	stateStore *session.StateStore
    17→	// stateStoreOnce ensures thread-safe lazy initialization
    18→	stateStoreOnce sync.Once
    19→	// stateStoreErr captures any error during initialization
    20→	stateStoreErr error
    21→
    22→	// checkpointStore manages checkpoint data in git
    23→	checkpointStore *checkpoint.GitStore
    24→	// checkpointStoreOnce ensures thread-safe lazy initialization
    25→	checkpointStoreOnce sync.Once
    26→	// checkpointStoreErr captures any error during initialization
    27→	checkpointStoreErr error
    28→}
    29→
    30→// getStateStore returns the session state store, initializing it lazily if needed.
    31→// Thread-safe via sync.Once.
    32→func (s *ManualCommitStrategy) getStateStore() (*session.StateStore, error) {
    33→	s.stateStoreOnce.Do(func() {
    34→		store, err := session.NewStateStore()
    35→		if err != nil {
    36→			s.stateStoreErr = fmt.Errorf("failed to create state store: %w", err)
    37→			return
    38→		}
    39→		s.stateStore = store
    40→	})
    41→	return s.stateStore, s.stateStoreErr
    42→}
    43→
    44→// getCheckpointStore returns the checkpoint store, initializing it lazily if needed.
    45→// Thread-safe via sync.Once.
    46→func (s *ManualCommitStrategy) getCheckpointStore() (*checkpoint.GitStore, error) {
    47→	s.checkpointStoreOnce.Do(func() {
    48→		repo, err := OpenRepository()
    49→		if err != nil {
    50→			s.checkpointStoreErr = fmt.Errorf("failed to open repository: %w", err)
    51→			return
    52→		}
    53→		s.checkpointStore = checkpoint.NewGitStore(repo)
    54→	})
    55→	return s.checkpointStore, s.checkpointStoreErr
    56→}
    57→

    59→//
    60→
